title: Product Intelligence Analyst (Remote)
description: The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.<p><br></p>You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities.<p><br></p>Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For more than 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection.<p><br></p><strong>We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them.</strong><p><br></p>Job Summary:<p><br></p>A Product Intelligence Analyst III will be responsible for participating in collaboration with clients to enable them with trusted actionable data to break down business problems into solvable components by assessing the requirements and/or business implications to arrive at recommended solutions with assistance from team members and managers. This role will support the delivery of ad-hoc requests and data quality efforts to clients.<p><br></p>Key Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li> Contributes in gathering requirements/understand purpose of request</li><li> Provides data extraction and analytical support for a variety of internal customers and external recipients</li><li> Inspects, cleans, tests and validates data to provide useful insights for decision making</li><li> Drills down into data to help provide explanations and solutions</li><li> Participates in presenting project deliverables and results to team members and/or internal clients</li><li> Supports the needs of modeling and analytics by delivering data based on client requirements.</li><li> Prepares test data, reconciles data sources and executes functional tests for each request</li><li> Documents programs and queries and supports the development of the PI WIKI</li><li> Works with data stewards in the testing/profiling of data and validation of newly captured data to ensure proper operation and accuracy</li><li> Supports troubleshooting data quality issues - documentation/communication of resolution</li></ul><p><br></p>Supervisory Responsibilities:<p><br></p>This job does not have supervisory duties.<p><br></p>Education and Experience:<p><br></p><ul><li> 4 year Bachelors Degree (Preferred)</li><li> 0-2 years experience (Preferred)</li><li> In lieu of the above education requirements, an equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.</li></ul><p><br></p>Certificates, Licenses, Registrations:<p><br></p><ul><li> No Certification, License or Registration is required for the job.</li></ul><p><br></p>Functional Skills:<p><br></p><ul><li> Intermediate analytical skills</li><li> Intermediate time and task management skills</li><li> Strong Attention to details</li><li> Intermediate Microsoft Office skills</li><li> Intermediate technology fluency in tools and software/programming languages with key analytic applications (SAS, MySQL, PL/SQL, Oracle, UNIX, OLAP, Tableau)</li><li> Intermediate written and verbal communication skills</li></ul><p><br></p>Compensation offered for this role is $48,000.00-$73,875.00 per year and is based on experience and qualifications.<p><br></p>The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.<p><br></p><strong>Good Work. Good Life. Good Hands®.</strong><p><br></p>As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary – but that’s just the beginning. Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you’ll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy. <u>For a full description of Allstate’s benefits, visit allstate.jobs/benefits/</u><p><br></p>Learn more about life at Allstate. Connect with us on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn or watch a video.<p><br></p><strong>Allstate generally does not sponsor individuals for employment-based visas for this position.</strong><p><br></p>Effective July 1, 2014, under Indiana House Enrolled Act (HEA) 1242, it is against public policy of the State of Indiana and a discriminatory practice for an employer to discriminate against a prospective employee on the basis of status as a veteran by refusing to employ an applicant on the basis that they are a veteran of the armed forces of the United States, a member of the Indiana National Guard or a member of a reserve component.<p><br></p>For jobs in San Francisco, please click “here” for information regarding the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.<p><br></p>For jobs in Los Angeles, please click “here” for information regarding the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.<p><br></p>To view the “EEO is the Law” poster click “here”. This poster provides information concerning the laws and procedures for filing complaints of violations of the laws with the Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs<p><br></p>To view the FMLA poster, click “here”. This poster summarizing the major provisions of the Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) and telling employees how to file a complaint.<p><br></p>It is the Company’s policy to employ the best qualified individuals available for all jobs. Therefore, any discriminatory action taken on account of an employee’s ancestry, age, color, disability, genetic information, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual and reproductive health decision, marital status, medical condition, military or veteran status, national origin, race (include traits historically associated with race, including, but not limited to, hair texture and protective hairstyles), religion (including religious dress), sex, or sexual orientation that adversely affects an employee's terms or conditions of employment is prohibited. This policy applies to all aspects of the employment relationship, including, but not limited to, hiring, training, salary administration, promotion, job assignment, benefits, discipline, and separation of employment.

title: Data Analyst, Operations Engineering
description: Invenergy drives innovation in energy. Powered by decades of entrepreneurial experience and unparalleled execution, we solve the energy challenges facing our customers and communities. We provide power generation and storage solutions at scale around the world to create a cleaner energy future. We develop. We build. We own. We operate. We are Invenergy.<br><br><strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong>Data Analyst, Operations Engineering<br><br><strong><u>About Invenergy<br><br></u></strong>Invenergy drives innovation in energy. Powered by decades of entrepreneurial experience and unparalleled execution, we solve the energy challenges facing our customers and communities. We provide power generation and storage solutions at scale around the world to create a cleaner energy future. We develop. We build. We own. We operate. We are Invenergy.<br><br>Position Overview<br><br>The Data Analyst, Operations Engineering primarily provides technical support to a large operating fleet of renewable energy projects by transforming data into actionable insights &amp; business intelligence, administering support for analytics tools and platforms, optimizing fleet performance, and guiding data-driven decisions.<br><br>Core Responsibilities<br><ul><li>Support cross-functional administrative &amp; operational needs for digital data &amp; analytics platform</li><li>Collaborate closely with operations engineering, asset management, and site technician teams</li><li>Curate metrics, KPI’s, and reports that transform equipment information into operational intelligence </li><li>Manage recurring reporting processes and identify actionable items</li><li>Perform ad-hoc analyses to quantify energy and revenue impact from operational events</li><li>Design and maintain dashboards to drive actionable insights </li><li>Support regulatory reporting requirements such as NERC GADS <br></li></ul><strong><u>Required Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline, engineering preferred </li><li>Proficiency with Excel and Microsoft Office</li><li>Proficiency with business intelligence tools such as Power BI or Tableau</li><li>Strong communication skills<br></li></ul><strong><u>Preferred Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Familiarity with utility-scale wind, solar, natural gas, or battery storage technology and operations</li><li>Familiarity with the OSIsoft PI software suite </li><li>Familiarity with database environments &amp; query languages (SQL preferred) </li><li>Familiarity with Python or other programming experience <br></li></ul><strong><u>Benefits<br><br></u></strong>Eligible for medical, dental, vision, 401(k), profit sharing, bonus, paid time off, etc.<br><br>Invenergy LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability.<br><br>Invenergy drives innovation in energy. Powered by decades of entrepreneurial experience and unparalleled execution, we solve the energy challenges facing our customers and communities. We provide power generation and storage solutions at scale around the world to create a cleaner energy future. We develop. We build. We own. We operate. We are Invenergy.

title: Data Engineer (Data Acquisition)
description: <strong>Data Engineer<br><br></strong><strong>Come join one of the premier financial firms where technology plays a huge part in our success. We have been around for over 20 years with offices spanning the globe. We are currently in a rapid change of technology initiatives and searching for experienced Data Engineers who can drive our new systems from design stage through implementation. Come partner with us and our highly skilled team members in building this system. <br><br></strong><strong>Best in class benefit package<br><br></strong><strong>We expect this person to have a background in several of the following:<br></strong><ul><li>Strong analytical, data, and programming skills (Python/SQL/NoSQL)</li><li>Spark/Hive/Hadoop</li><li>Experience orchestrating pipelines with a technology like Airflow/Luigi/Oozie/Nifi</li><li>Experience with cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)</li><li>Solid understanding of time series data and temporal queries <br></li></ul>Mid-Senior Level<br><br>
description_json: <strong>Data Engineer<br><br></strong><strong>Come join one of the premier financial firms where technology plays a huge part in our success. We have been around for over 20 years with offices spanning the globe. We are currently in a rapid change of technology initiatives and searching for experienced Data Engineers who can drive our new systems from design stage through implementation. Come partner with us and our highly skilled team members in building this system. <br><br></strong><strong>Best in class benefit package<br><br></strong><strong>We expect this person to have a background in several of the following:<br></strong><ul><li>Strong analytical, data, and programming skills (Python/SQL/NoSQL)</li><li>Spark/Hive/Hadoop</li><li>Experience orchestrating pipelines with a technology like Airflow/Luigi/Oozie/Nifi</li><li>Experience with cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)</li><li>Solid understanding of time series data and temporal queries <br></li></ul>Mid-Senior Level<br><br>

title: Data Analyst (19-22/hr)
description: <ul><li>Looking for:* *-Proficient in Excel (Highly proficient skills: create spreadsheets, formulas, Vlook ups and pivot tables is a plus)* *-2-4 years of data heavy position* *-HS Diploma or GED*</li><li>Hours:* Monday through Friday</li><li>8am to 5pm* 2 days in office, 3 days remote</li><li>Description:* The new business job family roles will be responsible for the retrieval, validation, and processing of all worksite and group benefit enrollment files and manual production submissions inclusive of file balancing and audits. The team will be responsible for accurate processing of new enrollments, routing of benefit changes, and handling of termination notifications. Job responsibilities:</li><li>Ability to work with large data sets and run simple formula (VLOOKUP and logic functions are a plus)</li><li>Perform quality assurance and testing to ensure accuracy of setup and ability to process new business</li><li>Retrieve data files from various enrollment platforms and secure server transmissions; validate format and completeness of information received based upon product requirements, and prepare to load into administrative system</li><li>Review state and product compliance requirements, ensure appropriate approvals have been received</li><li>Provide support to field sales, brokers, and employer groups to resolve issues, collect missing information, and ensure accuracy of information received</li><li>Investigate errors that occur on assigned employer groups, research issue and follow through to resolution partnering with internal stakeholders</li><li>Escalate errors and risks as appropriate to bring to resolution and management intervention</li><li>Meet or exceed department established production and quality goals, ensuring service levels are met</li><li>Provide superior customer support to internal and external customers<br><br></li></ul>About Aston Carter:<br><br>Please Note: Scammers are posing as Aston Carter. We'll never contact you via Gmail, Telegram, or WhatsApp and we'll never solicit money from you.<br><br>At Aston Carter, we’re dedicated to expanding career opportunities for the skilled professionals who power our business. Our success is driven by the talented, motivated people who join our team across a range of positions – from recruiting, sales and delivery to corporate roles. As part of our team, employees have the opportunity for long-term career success, where hard work is rewarded and the potential for growth is limitless. Established in 1997, Aston Carter is a leading staffing and consulting firm, providing high-caliber talent and premium services to more than 7,000 companies across North America. Spanning four continents and more than 200 offices, we extend our clients’ capabilities by seeking solvers and delivering solutions to address today’s workforce challenges. For organizations looking for innovative solutions shaped by critical-thinking professionals, visit [AstonCarter.com.](AstonCarter.com) Aston Carter is a company within Allegis Group, a global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to a disability, please call 888-237-6835 or email [astoncarteraccommodation@astoncarter.com](mailto:%20astoncarteraccommodation@astoncarter.com) for other accommodation options. However, if you have questions about this position, please contact the Recruiter located at the bottom of the job posting. The Recruiter is the sole point of contact for questions about this position.

title: Associate Data Warehouse Developer
description: Associate Data Warehouse Developer - INF001837<br><br>The Associate Data Warehouse Developer develops solutions required to extract, transform, clean, and move data from the business systems into the enterprise data warehouse, data mart and operational data stores. Other related responsibilities include ongoing support, maintenance, and other ETL related information technology endeavors such as data migration, data cleansing and data modeling.<br><br><strong>Location Note<br><br></strong><em>This role is a hybrid work arrangement where the candidate can perform this role in-office or remote. In-office expectations within our operating footprint will be limited and based on an on purpose, for a purpose model should a meeting or collaborative session be scheduled.<br><br></em><strong>Essential Functions<br></strong><ul><li>Participate in project planning sessions with Project Managers, Business Analysts, and Technical Architects to analyze business / technology requirements and outline the proposed technology solution as appropriate.</li><li>Develop code based on the detailed design specifications</li><li>Incorporate support, standards, and title: Database Engineer
description: <strong><u>Overview<br><br></u></strong>A self-motivated individual responsible for database object design, development, maintenance for the enterprise application data model and database administration both on-premise and in the Azure Cloud. Ensures enterprise database procedures, methodologies and standards are maintained across the application teams. Performs database promotions to all servers per Service Level Agreements. Provides necessary production problem resolution to support departmental server up time goals. Assists with SQL Server upgrades to the Enterprise.<br><br>This is a Hybrid position- requires minimal time in our Oakbrook Terrace, IL central office.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Provides login and security maintenance. </li><li> Monitors database performance. </li><li> Supports and provides tables, constraints, and triggers in a timely manner to several application development teams in a multi-tasking environment. </li><li> Reviews stored procedures and ensures that The Joint Commission database standards, guidelines, proper naming conventions and T-SQL coding techniques for optimal performance are enforced. </li><li> Creates logical and physical data model diagrams using 3 rd party tools. </li><li> Rotates on-call 24/7 production support. </li><li> Provides nonproduction and production promotions in a timely fashion according to SLA. </li><li> Monitors database integrity in a proactive manner. </li><li> Performs SQL Server installs and upgrades. </li><li> Supports the Disaster Recovery tests under supervision. </li><li> Performs other duties as requested by the team and business. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> Three to five years’ experience in relational database systems. </li><li> Experience with implementing SSIS / SSRS. </li><li> BS, BA degree in computer science or equivalent experience. </li><li> Lean / Six Sigma Yellow Belt </li><li> Microsoft Certified Azure Data Fundamentals is a plus. </li><li> Knowledge of a scripting language, preferably PowerShell or JSON or Python. </li><li> Demonstrated knowledge of relational database concepts and modeling, with a high technical aptitude in database management. </li><li> Experience in the use of SQL and T-SQL for query and transaction processing. </li><li> Working knowledge of a programming environment (i.e. .Net Framework, Entity Framework). </li><li> Excellent oral and written communication skills. </li><li> Excellent troubleshooting and performance tuning skills. </li><li> Ability to use Profiler and DMV. </li><li> Experience with data modeling tools. </li><li> 1-2 years’ experience with SQL Azure or any other cloud database platform. <br></li></ul><strong> Note: Successful applicants for domestic positions that require travel to a customer site must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. <br><br></strong>This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by an employee assigned to this position. The description is not an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, knowledge, skills, and abilities, and working conditions associated with this position. All requirements are subject to possible modification and reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.

title: Data/ Software Engineer - Freelance [Remote]
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote-United States only (TimeZone: EST | Partial overlap)</li><li>HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $100 – $112/hr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Long term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br><br></strong><strong>Qualifications that will make you successful in this role:<br></strong><ul><li>Working knowledge of Google Cloud Platform services such as Cloud Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Run</li><li>Python - Minimum 3 years, preferably 4-5</li><li>Analytics SQL - Ability to perform analysis and understand how to query output data<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualities that will help you thrive in this role: <br></strong><ul><li>You are willing to work with and improve code you did not originally write, primarily in Python and deployed in Cloud Run</li><li>You have some experience creating dashboards in tools such as Looker to derive insights from data stored in BigQuery tables</li><li>You are familiar with building and monitoring cloud services and infrastructure</li><li>You understand that being an effective software engineer is about communicating with people as much as it is about writing code</li><li>You can tackle unconstrained problems and know when to seek help</li></ul> <strong><strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong></strong><strong>What’s the role?<br><br></strong>Our client's Data Enablement organization's mission is to enable the use of data at scale and to unlock learning through experimentation. As part of the Data Governance &amp; Privacy team, you will join a highly visible team with a top priority of protecting sensitive information of our client's buyers and sellers. The team is responsible for building services and processes to protect Personally Identifiable Information (PII) in their data warehouses. You'll be part of their journey to modernize how they protect personal data.<br><br>They work with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services, such as Cloud Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Run, Cloud Pub/Sub, and Data Loss Prevention (DLP). Languages include Java, Python, PHP and SQL, and they work with technologies like Terraform, Spark, Airflow, and BigQuery. Experience with any of these is helpful; above all, they value curiosity, responsibility, and eagerness to solve complex engineering problems. They're looking for a flexible engineer, who can work with their internal customers, and embraces pivoting to the appropriate tool for the job rather than having deep expertise in single systems.<br><br>For this role, they are considering remote candidates. Their team is geographically dispersed, but work in North American Time Zones.<br><br><strong>What does the day-to-day look like?<br><br></strong>Our client is seeking a Senior Software Engineer to help deliver on two tracks of work<br><br>First, to help us analyze and audit Google Cloud Storage data to ensure security and compliance, they are building an inventory of our client's GCS file sets across Etsy’s hundreds of projects and thousands of buckets. They have performed a proof of concept of Google’s Storage Insight inventory report feature and moving to productionalize<br><ul><li>You will lead the development of automating the process of configuring Storage Insights features across thousands of buckets and ensure it scales well</li><li>You will use your knowledge of Cloud Storage including Cloud Audit Logs and Pub/Sub notifications to automate bucket discovery</li><li>You will use Cloud Run to automate processing data transformation on the inventory metadata</li><li>You will participate in meetings with Google technical leads to collaborate on feature request and issue resolution for Storage Insights, as this is an evolving feature Google is building<br><br></li></ul>Second, they are modernizing how they identify and protect PII data in their BigQuery tables. They are working to create standard for Column Tags and Policy Tags with the goal of automating PII data protection<br><ul><li>You will work with your team to develop methods to programmatically apply column tags and Policy Tags on BigQuery data sets to identify and protect Personally Identifiable Information</li><li>You will use your knowledge of Python to develop the endpoints of services responsible for automating adding of column tags and policy tags to BigQuery tables<br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6684<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Variable Data & Print Programmer
description: <p>Press America, Inc. is a full-service mailer/commercial printer located in Elk Grove Village. We have a full-time position available for an experienced Variable Data Processor to join our print management team.&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>The ideal candidate will have the following skillsets:</p><ul><li>Perform data hygiene and presort functions via presorting software.</li><li>Knowledge of USPS mailing/presorting requirements/DMM.</li><li>Understanding and performance of data manipulation and template setup for accurate data merge and output per client-specified requirements via BCC Mail Manager and Quadient Inspire Designer (formerly GMC/PrintNet T).</li><li>Update/provide proofs, production PDF files, inkjet files, along with instructional documentation and communications to the production team for final output.</li><li>Perform quality checks and control.</li><li>Troubleshoot complex application issues and improve performance as needed.</li></ul><p><br></p><p>Responsibilities:</p><ul><li>Responsible for reviewing and verifying all work before it leaves the department for accuracy.</li><li>Must be reliable, dependable and have the ability to work independently.</li><li>Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with tight deadline requirements.</li><li>Must have self-motivation, ability to follow written and verbal direction, and work with others.</li><li>Prepare customer data for mailings including analysis, de‐dupe, presort using mailing software.</li><li>Program / prepare soft and live proofs using Quadient Inspire Designer.</li><li>Effectively execute mailings for diverse client portfolio.</li><li>Customer communications.</li><li>Review job information for accuracy per client requirements and production output, and update as required.</li></ul><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>Qualifications - This is not an entry level position.</p><ul><li>2 years minimum experience with Quadient Inspire Designer. Must possess strong skills in Quadient Inspire Designer to write logic, and precisely layout variable and static elements for direct mail pieces.</li><li>Understanding of Quadient scripting language, including sheet impositioning.</li><li>Knowledge of comparable presorting software required; BCC preferred.</li><li>Ability to process customer data files for postal qualification, including CASS, NCOA and Presort.</li><li>Take daily direction and possess the ability to comprehend written and verbal instructions.&nbsp;Must have outstanding communication skills with co-workers and customers.</li><li>Experience with: MS Office Suite, Adobe InDesign / Acrobat</li><li>Knowledge of USPS regulations a plus</li></ul><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Competitive pay, plus benefits: paid vacation, health/dental/life insurance, 401k with company match.</p><p><br></p><p>Because our team members are trusted to handle sensitive information, we require all candidates that receive and accept employment offers to complete a background check.&nbsp;Additional background clearances may be required after employment due to client contract requirements.</p><p><br></p><p>Job Type: Full-time</p><p>Location: Elk Grove Village, IL</p>

title: Engineer I Interconnection and Grid Analysis
description: Invenergy drives innovation in energy. Powered by decades of entrepreneurial experience and unparalleled execution, we solve the energy challenges facing our customers and communities. We provide power generation and storage solutions at scale around the world to create a cleaner energy future. We develop. We build. We own. We operate. We are Invenergy.<br><br><strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong>Position Overview<br><br>The Engineer I, Interconnections and Grid Analysis will perform technical analysis to assist in the interconnection process for the different generation projects. Based out of Invenergy’s Chicago office, the Engineer I, Interconnections will also be responsible for assisting in other transmission associated activities and analysis, including interpreting the different market rules as they apply to the interconnection process.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Support submission and management of new Generation Interconnection Requests</li><li>Perform power flow analysis and market related evaluations as part of generation and transmission development activities.</li><li>Provide grid, transmission system planning and congestion evaluation, to assist in development activities mainly in NYISO, PJM, ISONE and SERC regions.</li><li>Review utility and ISO transmission expansion plans to identify potential opportunities.</li><li>Review utility interconnection studies (impact, stability and facility).</li><li>Identify areas for new transmission projects based on generation technological shifts and the corresponding impacts it has on grid behavior.</li><li>Utilize regulatory and compliance knowledge to identify and evaluate areas of critical impact for projects in the interconnection pipeline.</li><li>Interpret market rules as they apply to the interconnection study, construction, and operation of generation projects</li><li>Work with regulatory team to provide input on queue reforms and process changes as necessary.</li><li>Develop conceptual design of interconnection facilities and costs.</li><li>Assist in conceptual design of wind farm and solar electrical collection systems (34.5kV), substations (34.5kV – transmission voltage 115kV – 230kV – 345kV), and project owned transmission lines.</li><li>Perform technical diligence for potential M&amp;A projects</li><li>Perform complex Transmission delivery assessments to support Origination and business opportunities for RFPs.</li><li>Coordinate with consultants to prepare system models and perform reliability and economic studies.</li><li>Establish relationships with various technical experts among stakeholders, utilities, RTO/ISOs.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Required Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>BS or MS in Electrical Engineering with a focus on power systems</li><li>0-1 year of experience in transmission system planning, compliance and operations including complex power flow, short circuit, and stability studies.</li><li>Proficiency in spreadsheet modeling using Microsoft Excel.</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills<br></li></ul><strong><u>Preferred<br></u></strong><ul><li>Knowledge of FERC, NERC standards related to transmission and interconnections, including Open Access Transmission Tariff (OATT) a plus.</li><li>NYISO, PJM, SERC, ISONE experience preferred.</li><li>Experienced in the use one of power flow software such as PSS/E, TARA, PowerWorld, PSLF, or PSCAD similar software package a plus. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Benefits<br><br></u></strong>Eligible for medical, dental, vision, 401(k), bonus, paid time off, etc.<br><br>Invenergy LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability.<br><br>Invenergy drives innovation in energy. Powered by decades of entrepreneurial experience and unparalleled execution, we solve the energy challenges facing our customers and communities. We provide power generation and storage solutions at scale around the world to create a cleaner energy future. We develop. We build. We own. We operate. We are Invenergy.

title: Software Engineering Data Analyst
description: <strong>Who We Are</strong><p><br></p>At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<p><br></p><strong>This Opportunity</strong><p><br></p>Be involved in projects with our Technology Team and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.<p><br></p>At WSP, we are driven by inspiring the right people to be part of our future-focused business objectives. Our devotion to teamwork has allowed us to build communities and expand our skylines. Here at WSP, anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!<p><br></p>WSP is currently initiating a search for a Software Engineering Data Analyst for our <strong>Chicago, IL</strong> office.<p><br></p><strong>Your Impact</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>The successful candidate will be working in the core Microsoft .NET environment on Windows Servers and Windows 10 and Windows Server environments developing web and mobile device using the mean (React or Vue, Angular, and Node) development stack including C#, ASP.NET and SQL Server.</li><li>The role requires individuals to work well in teams in creating solutions to meet customer needs. </li><li>The position requires attendance/lead capability in design and user requirements sessions with other developers, working closely with others to produce viable, cross application software solutions. </li><li>The successful candidate will need to work hands-on and provide the technical knowledge in the design, development, implementation, maintenance, and support of the enterprise information systems.</li><li>The position requires a variety of service knowledge and experience ranging from day-to-day support, maintenance, design, development, and trouble-shooting to improve, advance, or simplify business processes.</li></ul><p><br></p>The position will require the ability to structure and analyze database driven data into centralized dashboards and reports using technologies such as Microsoft Power BI, Tableau and other business intelligence software platforms as needed.<p><br></p><strong>Who You Are</strong><p><br></p><strong>Required Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree with three or more years development experience with ASP.NET/C#</li><li>Minimum of 7-10+ years experience required</li><li>Net Core, LINQ, Windows Workflow Foundation, Entity Framework combined with good foundation knowledge on C# to Create and Consuming Services RESTFul services. </li><li>Must be proficient with MVC, WPF, HTML5, CSS3, React, Vue, JQuery, Angular Transact-SQL with SQL Server, MVC frameworks. </li><li>The candidate must be willing work with existing code bases and demonstrate a desire to learn and work with existing application and business processes. </li><li>Experience in working and delivering solutions using business intelligence software.</li><li>Candidates with experience in developing webparts / App Parts, and integrating with SharePoint environments using REST, JSOM, and CSOM and service level integrations will be considered favorable along with the experience develop using MEAN stack framework. </li><li>Must have a good UI design experience. We will need to see sample screenshots of web applications developed to demonstrate clean user interface development experience. </li><li>Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug/alcohol and harassment policies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>SharePoint and/or .NET/Microsoft certifications are desired.</li><li>Experience in development systems in support of construction, engineering, design and project management/control functions is highly desired</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Additional Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.<br><br></li></ul> <strong>Additional Details</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Travel Required: N/A - No travel required</li><li>Job Status: Regular</li><li>Employee Type: Full</li><li>Primary Location: CHICAGO - 30 N LASALLE ST</li><li>All locations: US-IL-Chicago<br><br></li></ul> <strong>About WSP</strong><p><br></p>WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com<p><br></p>WSP provides a flexible and agile workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.<p><br></p>At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be essential in meeting client objectives, goals and challenges. Are you ready to get started?<p><br></p>WSP USA (and all of its U.S. companies) is an Equal Opportunity Employer Race/Age/Color/Religion/Sex/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/National Origin/Disability or Protected Veteran Status.<p><br></p>The selected candidate must be authorized to work in the United States.<p><br></p>

title: *Remote* Systems Engineer
description: Our client is in need of a Systems Engineer for a 100% Remote - 6 month Contract engagement as they migrate into Office 365.<br><br> Top Skills' Details <br><ul><li> Previous migration experience into Microsoft Office 365 (4-5 years) - The workload itself will include the migration of thousands of new users from existing email platforms into Office 365.</li><li> Azure Active Directory experience</li><li> Windows server experience<br><br></li></ul> Preference is to have someone local to Chicago or Minnesota (will consider 100% remote)  - for one off scenarios dealing with Datacenter environments / team building events.<br><br> Nice To Haves <br><br>SSO - OKTA<br><br>BitTitan / Sharegate - Migration Tool<br><br>Microsoft Endpoint Manager<br><br>Powershell<br><br> Job Description <br><br>Under general direction, formulates and defines specifications for complex systems, which may include Engineering, implementation and integration, and technical services and support. Designs, Implements or installs, maintains and administers infrastructures including Hardware, software, and configurations. Monitors overall performance to proactively identify potential issues and tunes, accordingly. Performs root cause analysis on failed components and implements corrective measures.<br><br>Works with others to establish and improve processes and procedures. May have sole responsibility for projects. May provide guidance and oversight to junior resources.<br><br> Responsibilities <br><ul><li>Designs and Implements, configures and manages solutions within the following systems, products and services: Microsoft Windows Servers Systems, Microsoft Exchange, Active Directory, SharePoint, Microsoft Office 365 and Azure Cloud, Linux Systems, VMware.</li><li>Monitors and proactively manages supported products and services to assure their performance, availability, security and capacity.</li><li>Diagnoses, isolates, and resolves problems with supported technologies, product and services. Identifies and documents root cause.</li><li>Serves as a point of contact representing supported technologies, products, and services to other IT groups.<br><br></li></ul> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.<br><br>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: O365 Engineer
description: TEKsystems is looking for a Security Engineer with M365 and Windows/Linux server experience to join our team.<br><br> Description <br><br>Assess the security posture of our systems, applications, and infrastructure and design and implement strategies for asset hardening (baseline security configurations). Identify misconfigurations, and weaknesses in systems and apply appropriate security controls and countermeasures to mitigate risks.<br><br>Collaborate with system administrators, network engineers, and application developers to engineer and harden assets at all layers, including operating systems, cloud platforms, databases, and network devices. Engineer and maintain security controls within the Microsoft 365 environment, including Azure Active Directory, Exchange Online, SharePoint, Intune and Teams. Configure and enforce security policies, data loss prevention (DLP) measures, and threat protection mechanisms to safeguard our assets. Stay informed about emerging security technologies and trends and provide recommendations for their adoption.<br><br>Software Requirements<br><br>Active Directory (Azure, On-prem)<br><br>AWS (Desirable)<br><br>M365<br><br>Windows Servers (2016 and newer)<br><br>Linux (Desirable)<br><br>Containers (Desirable)<br><br> Experience Required <br><br>5 years of experience as a Security Engineer or in a similar role, with experience in asset hardening and Microsoft 365 security.<br><br>Scripting/automation experience such as Python and PowerShell<br><br>Ability to work both independently and with a team while managing workload with minimal supervision.<br><br>Strong knowledge of servers, networking, cloud technologies, and related security considerations.<br><br>Familiarity with security principles, frameworks, and compliance standards (e.g., NIST, CIS)<br><br>Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to analyze complex technical issues.<br><br>Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.<br><br>Ability to travel and collaborate in the downtown Chicago office two days a week.<br><br> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.<br><br>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

Identify misconfigurations, and weaknesses in systems and apply appropriate security controls and countermeasures to mitigate risks.<br><br>Collaborate with system administrators, network engineers, and application developers to engineer and harden assets at all layers, including operating systems, cloud platforms, databases, and network devices. Engineer and maintain security controls within the Microsoft 365 environment, including Azure Active Directory, Exchange Online, SharePoint, Intune and Teams. Configure and enforce security policies, data loss prevention (DLP) measures, and threat protection mechanisms to safeguard our assets. Stay informed about emerging security technologies and trends and provide recommendations for their adoption.<br><br>Software Requirements<br><br>Active Directory (Azure, On-prem)<br><br>AWS (Desirable)<br><br>M365<br><br>Windows Servers (2016 and newer)<br><br>Linux (Desirable)<br><br>Containers (Desirable)<br><br> Experience Required <br><br>5 years of experience as a Security Engineer or in a similar role, with experience in asset hardening and Microsoft 365 security.<br><br>Scripting/automation experience such as Python and PowerShell<br><br>Ability to work both independently and with a team while managing workload with minimal supervision.<br><br>Strong knowledge of servers, networking, cloud technologies, and related security considerations.<br><br>Familiarity with security principles, frameworks, and compliance standards (e.g., NIST, CIS)<br><br>Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to analyze complex technical issues.<br><br>Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.<br><br>Ability to travel and collaborate in the downtown Chicago office two days a week.<br><br> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.<br><br>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: W2 Security Engineer
description: Salary: $110k-$120k<p><br></p>Location: East Chicago, IN<p><br></p>*Hybrid role. Must live within 1 hr. distance for occasional in-office travel*<p><br></p>*This role is unable to provide sponsorship*<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Business, Computer Science or related field.</li><li>3-5 years of enterprise IT security engineering experience</li><li>Knowledge of security and control frameworks, such as ISO 17799, COBIT, and NIST CyberSecurity Framework.</li><li>Systems Security Certified Practitioner (SSCP), CompTIA Security+, or GIAC Security Essentials Certification (GSEC) certification required or must be obtained within 2 years of hire.</li><li>Experience with ProofPoint, Cisco AMP, SpecOps and other industry standard security tools.</li><li>Experience with Palo Alto Firewalls</li><li>Advanced knowledge of Network Security, Endpoint Security, Server hardening, patching, and base-lining, Mobile device security, Data Loss Prevention, IDS/IPS, Log analysis</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Cisco ISE or NAC experience</li><li>Scripting (Python, Perl, Powershell) knowledge</li><li>CISSP</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Maintain and implement the cybersecurity infrastructure and program</li><li>Collaborate with other technical teams to respond to threats as well as on a daily basis to maintain the security posture of the environment.</li><li>Work on highly complex projects and maintains knowledge across multiple domains (networking, server, end points, mobile, cloud, etc.)</li><li>Involved in patching, maintaining Firewalls, scanning for vulnerabilities, keeping current on the latest security threats and trends, and reviewing technical architecture for security compliance</li></ul>

description: Job TitleNoSql Developer<p><br></p>Relevant Experience<p><br></p>(in Yrs)4+<p><br></p>Technical/Functional Skills<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience in working as database developer and administrator</li><li>Experience in working with databases like MongoDB, Cosmos DB, Cassandra.</li><li>Experience in handling, configuration, and administration of NoSQL databases like MongoDB and Cassandra.</li><li>Deep understanding of NoSQL and relational databases and database fundamentals, including data storage, data modeling, and data access patterns</li><li>Experience in analyzing and visualizing the data along with data modeling.</li><li>Install, configure, patch, and upgrade database software (MySQL, MySQL cluster, Cassandra, Cosmos DB, and MongoDB)</li><li>Design indexing strategies, Configure, monitor, and deploy replica sets</li><li>Extensive knowledge of table architecture, index use, query plan analysis, and performance improvement</li><li>Investigate, analyze, and present existing and new NoSQL solutions, as well as the best use cases for them</li><li>Experience in trouble shooting /performance tuning.</li><li>Applying technical design and development skills to the creation of database programs</li><li>Create and configure monitors to establish the health of servers and the databases running on them</li><li>Troubleshoot NoSQL issues and performance bottlenecks</li><li>Design, implement, maintain and automate the appropriate backup and recovery architecture as required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Experience RequiredMinimum 5-8 Years</u></strong><p><br></p>Roles &amp; Responsibilities<p><br></p><ul><li>NoSQL developer in critical Retail / Healthcare applications</li><li>Engineer part of a high performing team aimed at implementing the world class systems in Retail / Healthcare domain</li><li>Previous working experience as a NoSQL Developer for 5-8 year(s)</li><li>To achieve peak database performance, the experience should encompass collection building, access method tweaking, sharding implementation, index construction, and debugging query execution</li><li>Hands on experience with Linux system administration, including hardware and software troubleshooting, system maintenance, and design</li><li>Outstanding organizational and time management skills</li><li>Analytical thinker with problem solving aptitude</li></ul><p><br></p>EducationBachelors or Masters with Majors in Science, EE, IT, CS, ECE etc<p><br></p>Start date (dd-mmm-yy)01-Apr-2023<p><br></p>Duration of assignment (in Months)12+ Months<p><br></p>Work Location (State, City and Zip)Deerfield IL<p><br></p>Key words to search in resumeCosmos, Mongo, Cassandra

title: NoSql Developer
description: C3.ai, Inc. (NYSE:AI) is a leading provider of Enterprise AI software for accelerating digital transformation. The proven C3 AI Platform provides comprehensive services to build enterprise-scale AI applications more efficiently and cost-effectively than alternative approaches. The core of the C3 AI offering is an open, data-driven AI architecture that dramatically simplifies data science and application development. Learn more at: www.c3.ai<br><br>C3 AI is seeking Solution Engineers. As a Solution Engineer, you will be engineering full-stack AI-driven web applications on the C3 AI Platform. You will be working directly with our customers to design, develop, and deploy production applications, demos, and proofs-of-technology. An ideal candidate possesses strategic and analytical aptitude, software development expertise, and excellent interpersonal skills.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Develop and deploy full-stack, AI-based enterprise applications on the C3 AI Platform </li><li>Mentor junior team members on coding standards and design techniques </li><li>Conduct design and development reviews of customer software applications </li><li>Test, troubleshoot, and enhance customer software applications with and on behalf of customers </li><li>Deliver technical deep-dives, demonstrations, and customer training </li><li>Write application specifications and documentation </li><li>Continuously identify technical risks and gaps; devise mitigation strategies in anticipation of customer needs </li><li>Work closely with product management and engineering to drive improvements to the overall quality of C3 AI software <br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM), or comparable area of study </li><li>2+ years of professional software development experience with object-oriented programming languages </li><li>Strong verbal and written communication, and ability to work effectively on a cross-functional team </li><li>Analytical and problem-solving abilities </li><li>Organizational skills and attention to detail </li><li>Ability to travel as needed <br></li></ul><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>Graduate degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM), or comparable area of study </li><li>Experience deploying enterprise scale applications </li><li>Experience working in a customer-facing role </li><li>Software development experience with JavaScript and Python </li><li>Experience with Git or other version control software </li><li>Experience working with JavaScript frameworks such as React, Redux, Vue, Backbone, or Angular </li><li>Experience deploying software to least one of the leading cloud computing platforms (i.e., GCP, AWS, Azure)</li><li>Understanding of SQL and NoSQL databases</li><li>Proficiency in data structure and algorithm design and implementation</li><li>Proficiency in time-series data analysis, cleansing, and normalization</li><li>Working knowledge of Agile software development methodology</li><li>Solid understanding of common machine learning techniques, applications, and trade-offs</li><li>Domain expertise in one or more of the following industries: Aerospace, Financial Services, Healthcare, Industrial Manufacturing, Oil &amp; Gas, Public Sector, Power &amp; Utilities, Supply Chain, Telecommunications <br></li></ul>C3 AI provides excellent benefits and a competitive compensation package, which include:<br><ul><li>Generous equity plan.</li><li>Salary range: $125,000 - $150,000 USD.<br></li></ul>C3 AI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of any legally protected characteristics, including disabled and veteran status.

title: Solution Engineer
description: This opportunity is working directly with a leading mission-critical data center developer / wholesaler / colo provider. This firm provides data center solutions custom-fit to the requirements of their client's mission-critical operational facilities. They provide reliability of mission-critical facilities for many of the world's largest organizations facilities supporting Enterprise Clients and Hyperscale Companies. This opportunity provides a career-growth minded role with exciting projects with leading-edge technology and innovation as well as competitive salaries and benefits.<br><br><strong>Data Center Facility Engineer - Schaumburg, IL<br><br></strong>We are looking for a Data Center Facility Engineer to support a critical data center. The Critical Facility Engineer will be responsible for monitoring compliance with contractual commitments, directing technical and administrative tasks related to the operation of the critical facility infrastructure and assuring compliance with company’s policies and procedures. The Data Center is a 7x24x365 a year operation.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Troubleshoot and Run Diagnostics, Conduct Preventive Maintenance and Emergency Repairs on Critical Facilities Equipment within the Data Center as specified and on schedule</li><li>Participates in the preparation of analyses and reports on the data center infrastructure, develops project plans and conducts briefings and presentations</li><li>Partner when necessary with sub-contractors and vendors</li><li>Operate and perform both routine and emergency service on a variety of state of the art critical systems, including but not limited to; Critical power - low/medium voltage switchgear, diesel generators, paralleling switchboards, UPS, PDU, and building monitoring systems</li><li>Ensures that operational, maintenance and emergency methods of procedure (MOP’s and SOP’s) are developed and strictly adhered to</li><li>Assist with CMMS database management</li></ul> <strong>Qualifications:<br></strong><ul><li>5+ years of relevant / technical knowledge and practical experience of Critical Facilities Operations with Electrical and Mechanical / HVAC equipment such as: UPS, Generators, Switchgears, PDU's, CRAC Units, DC Power Systems, CRAH Units, Chillers, Air handling units, computer grade cooling systems, CRAH Units, DC Power Systems, and building monitoring/control systems</li><li>Must have experience in operating, troubleshooting and maintenance of Mission Critical Mechanical and/or Electrical Support Systems</li><li>Previous experience in the Military / Military veterans in all branches that have experience with Electrical / Mechanical is a huge plus (Navy Nukes- EMN, ETN, MMNs, Seabees, Army - Power Generation, Air Force – Power Production, Generator Techs, Maritime, Coast Guard, etc.)</li><li>Strong verbal, written communications skills</li><li>Experience working with various computer systems and applications</li></ul> <strong>Submittal Instructions:<br><br></strong>Please send your resume to resume@pkaza.com ( resume at pkaza dot com ) with 16203035 in the subject. After applying, if you have further questions, you may call 973-895-5200 and ask for Iggy. You can also submit via our career portal and take a look at other Critical Facility openings we are working on at, https://www.pkaza.com/jobs/<br><br>If you are in Data Center Facilities but this opportunity is not what you are looking for let’s still talk. New openings are coming in weekly and others we are not allowed to post.<br><br>We also not only keep leads confidential but pay for referrals as well.<br><br>Company offers competitive salaries and benefits package including medical insurance, a 401(k) plan.<br><br><em>EOE/AA Employer M/F/D/V<br><br></em><em>Pkaza, LLC is a third party employment firm. All fees assessed by Pkaza will be paid by our employer that we represent and not by the candidate</em>
