title: DevOps Python Engineer
description: <strong>Description</strong><p><br></p><em>Junior Back End (Associate / Senior Associate), Tax Technology</em><p><br></p>Alvarez &amp; Marsal’s Taxand practice is seeking a talented junior developer (back end or full stack) to join the tax technology team. This hire will be responsible for designing, developing, implementing and supporting world class software. Your software will operate in all facets of A&M Taxand; from internal tools that improve efficiencies to client facing enterprise systems that compete at the world level.<p><br></p><em>How you'll contribute</em><p><br></p><ul><li>Consult with clients and subject matter experts (SMEs) to understand the problems</li><li>Contribute to envisioning elegant solutions to some of the most challenging business problems</li><li>Contribute to designing clean architecture with an emphasis on reusable components</li><li>Build efficient and explainable code</li><li>Test your work to a high standard</li><li>Contribute to all aspects of a project’s lifecycle: documenting requirements, solution development, system configuration, testing, debugging, and support</li></ul><p><br></p><em>Who will you be working with?</em><p><br></p>We are not a typical tax firm. We are a group of entrepreneurial, action oriented and results oriented tax professionals who take a hands-on approach to solving our clients’ problems and helping them reach their potential. We are nimble, resourceful, and proactive but adapt quickly when changes are needed. We present you with opportunities, not a playbook, and we reward you based on your achievements, not your tenure.<p><br></p><em>How will you grow and be supported?</em><p><br></p>As a demonstration of A&amp;M’s strong commitment to its people, we offer benefits to support your career, personal and professional development. This includes an equity investment in a diversified financial services firm, the ability to invest in A&amp;M private equity funds at beneficial terms, and a health and wellness program. Click to learn about our commitment to your well-being. A&amp;M recognizes that our people fuel our growth, and you and your team will be provided with the best available training and development resources, as well as networking opportunities. Learn more about why A&amp;M is a great place work.<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><ul><li>A Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Management Information Systems, or Information Technology &amp; Accounting</li><li>A practical approach to building software</li><li>1 to 3 years of experience working with</li><ul><li>Microsoft .NET, C#</li><li>Relational Databases systems like MSSQL or Oracle</li><li>API Development and testing</li><li>Azure</li></ul><li>A natural flair for problem solving and an entrepreneurial approach to work</li><li>A strong interest in technology and its use in business processes</li><li>Ability to learn and apply new technologies</li><li>Excellent communication and business writing skills</li><li>Strong organizational and time management skills</li></ul><p><br></p><em>Diversity &amp; Inclusion</em><p><br></p>A&amp;M’s entrepreneurial culture celebrates independent thinkers and doers who can positively impact our clients and shape our industry. The collaborative environment and engaging work—guided by A&amp;M’s core values of Integrity, Quality, Objectivity, Fun, Personal Reward, and Inclusive Diversity—are the main reasons our people love working at A&amp;M. Inclusive Diversity means we embrace diversity and we foster inclusiveness. It runs through how we recruit, develop employees, conduct business, support clients, and partner with vendors. It is the A&amp;M way.<p><br></p>Voluntary Inclusion<p><br></p>It is Alvarez &amp; Marsal’s policy to provide and promote equal opportunity in employment, compensation, and other terms and conditions of employment without discrimination because of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, family medical history or genetic information, political affiliation, military service, pregnancy, marital status, family status, religion, national origin, age or disability or any other non-merit based factor in accordance with all applicable laws and regulations.<p><br></p>Unsolicited Resumes from Third-Party Recruiters<p><br></p>Please note that as per A&amp;M policy, we do not accept unsolicited resumes from third-party recruiters unless such recruiters were engaged to provide candidates for a specified opening. Any employment agency, person or entity that submits an unsolicited resume does so with the understanding that A&amp;M will have the right to hire that applicant at its discretion without any fee owed to the submitting employment agency, person or entity.<p><br></p>Diversity &amp; Inclusion<p><br></p>A&amp;M’s entrepreneurial culture celebrates independent thinkers and doers who can positively impact our clients and shape our industry. The collaborative environment and engaging work—guided by A&amp;M’s core values of Integrity, Quality, Objectivity, Fun, Personal Reward, and Inclusive Diversity—are the main reasons our people love working at A&amp;M. Inclusive Diversity means we embrace diversity, and we foster inclusiveness, encouraging everyone to bring their whole self to work each day. It runs through how we recruit, develop employees, conduct business, support clients, and partner with vendors. It is the A&amp;M way.<p><br></p>Voluntary Inclusion<p><br></p>It is Alvarez &amp; Marsal’s practice to provide and promote equal opportunity in employment, compensation, and other terms and conditions of employment without discrimination because of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, family medical history or genetic information, political affiliation, military service, pregnancy, marital status, family status, religion, national origin, age or disability or any other non-merit based factor or any other characteristics in accordance with all applicable laws and regulations.<p><br></p>Unsolicited Resumes from Third-Party Recruiters<p><br></p>Please note that as per A&amp;M policy, we do not accept unsolicited resumes from third-party recruiters unless such recruiters are engaged to provide candidates for a specified opening and in alignment with our Inclusive Diversity values. Any employment agency, person or entity that submits an unsolicited resume does so with the understanding that A&amp;M will have the right to hire that applicant at its discretion without any fee owed to the submitting employment agency, person or entity.
description_json: <strong>Description</strong><p><br></p><em>Junior Back End (Associate / Senior Associate), Tax Technology</em><p><br></p>Alvarez &amp; Marsal’s Taxand practice is seeking a talented junior developer (back end or full stack) to join the tax technology team. This hire will be responsible for designing, developing, implementing and supporting world class software. Your software will operate in all facets of A&M Taxand; from internal tools that improve efficiencies to client facing enterprise systems that compete at the world level.<p><br></p><em>How you'll contribute</em><p><br></p><ul><li>Consult with clients and subject matter experts (SMEs) to understand the problems</li><li>Contribute to envisioning elegant solutions to some of the most challenging business problems</li><li>Contribute to designing clean architecture with an emphasis on reusable components</li><li>Build efficient and explainable code</li><li>Test your work to a high standard</li><li>Contribute to all aspects of a project’s lifecycle: documenting requirements, solution development, system configuration, testing, debugging, and support</li></ul><p><br></p><em>Who will you be working with?</em><p><br></p>We are not a typical tax firm. We are a group of entrepreneurial, action oriented and results oriented tax professionals who take a hands-on approach to solving our clients’ problems and helping them reach their potential. We are nimble, resourceful, and proactive but adapt quickly when changes are needed. We present you with opportunities, not a playbook, and we reward you based on your achievements, not your tenure.<p><br></p><em>How will you grow and be supported?</em><p><br></p>As a demonstration of A&amp;M’s strong commitment to its people, we offer benefits to support your career, personal and professional development. This includes an equity investment in a diversified financial services firm, the ability to invest in A&amp;M private equity funds at beneficial terms, and a health and wellness program. Click to learn about our commitment to your well-being. A&amp;M recognizes that our people fuel our growth, and you and your team will be provided with the best available training and development resources, as well as networking opportunities. Learn more about why A&amp;M is a great place work.<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><ul><li>A Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Management Information Systems, or Information Technology &amp; Accounting</li><li>A practical approach to building software</li><li>1 to 3 years of experience working with</li><ul><li>Microsoft .NET, C#</li><li>Relational Databases systems like MSSQL or Oracle</li><li>API Development and testing</li><li>Azure</li></ul><li>A natural flair for problem solving and an entrepreneurial approach to work</li><li>A strong interest in technology and its use in business processes</li><li>Ability to learn and apply new technologies</li><li>Excellent communication and business writing skills</li><li>Strong organizational and time management skills</li></ul><p><br></p><em>Diversity &amp; Inclusion</em><p><br></p>A&amp;M’s entrepreneurial culture celebrates independent thinkers and doers who can positively impact our clients and shape our industry. The collaborative environment and engaging work—guided by A&amp;M’s core values of Integrity, Quality, Objectivity, Fun, Personal Reward, and Inclusive Diversity—are the main reasons our people love working at A&amp;M. Inclusive Diversity means we embrace diversity and we foster inclusiveness. It runs through how we recruit, develop employees, conduct business, support clients, and partner with vendors. It is the A&amp;M way.<p><br></p>Voluntary Inclusion<p><br></p>It is Alvarez &amp; Marsal’s policy to provide and promote equal opportunity in employment, compensation, and other terms and conditions of employment without discrimination because of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, family medical history or genetic information, political affiliation, military service, pregnancy, marital status, family status, religion, national origin, age or disability or any other non-merit based factor in accordance with all applicable laws and regulations.<p><br></p>Unsolicited Resumes from Third-Party Recruiters<p><br></p>Please note that as per A&amp;M policy, we do not accept unsolicited resumes from third-party recruiters unless such recruiters were engaged to provide candidates for a specified opening. Any employment agency, person or entity that submits an unsolicited resume does so with the understanding that A&amp;M will have the right to hire that applicant at its discretion without any fee owed to the submitting employment agency, person or entity.<p><br></p>Diversity &amp; Inclusion<p><br></p>A&amp;M’s entrepreneurial culture celebrates independent thinkers and doers who can positively impact our clients and shape our industry. The collaborative environment and engaging work—guided by A&amp;M’s core values of Integrity, Quality, Objectivity, Fun, Personal Reward, and Inclusive Diversity—are the main reasons our people love working at A&amp;M. Inclusive Diversity means we embrace diversity, and we foster inclusiveness, encouraging everyone to bring their whole self to work each day. It runs through how we recruit, develop employees, conduct business, support clients, and partner with vendors. It is the A&amp;M way.<p><br></p>Voluntary Inclusion<p><br></p>It is Alvarez &amp; Marsal’s practice to provide and promote equal opportunity in employment, compensation, and other terms and conditions of employment without discrimination because of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, family medical history or genetic information, political affiliation, military service, pregnancy, marital status, family status, religion, national origin, age or disability or any other non-merit based factor or any other characteristics in accordance with all applicable laws and regulations.<p><br></p>Unsolicited Resumes from Third-Party Recruiters<p><br></p>Please note that as per A&amp;M policy, we do not accept unsolicited resumes from third-party recruiters unless such recruiters are engaged to provide candidates for a specified opening and in alignment with our Inclusive Diversity values. Any employment agency, person or entity that submits an unsolicited resume does so with the understanding that A&amp;M will have the right to hire that applicant at its discretion without any fee owed to the submitting employment agency, person or entity.

title: Data Center Facility Engineer
description: There are over 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we're all about at John Deere. And it's why we're investing in our people and our technology like never before! Here the world's brightest minds are tackling the world's biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we'll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.<p><br></p>John Deere is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to, among other things, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.<p><br></p><strong>Primary Location:</strong> United States (US) - Illinois - Chicago<p><br></p><strong>Function:</strong> Technology (CA)<p><br></p><strong>Title: </strong>Software Engineer (Chicago, IL or Moline, IL) - 98009<p><br></p><strong>Onsite/Remote:</strong>Partial Remote Position<p><br></p>This position may be located in Chicago, IL or Moline, IL per the hiring manager's discretion. This may be dependent on the successful candidate's background, experience, and proficiency.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Your Responsibilities</strong></strong><p><br></p>As a <strong>Software Engineer</strong> for <strong>John Deere Finacial</strong> located in <strong>Chicago, IL or Moline, IL</strong>, you will...<p><br></p><ul><li> Work on a product team to develop and support critical features for John Deere data products </li><li> Evaluate, design, and implement solutions to improve cost, quality, and performance of data products </li><li> Work alongside other team members promoting a DevSecOps culture </li><li> Participate in data delivery and modernization initiatives for the product </li><li> Solve well-defined problems with little guidance </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>VISA Sponsorship is NOT available for this position.</strong><p><br></p><strong>What Skills You Need</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 3 or more years of proven experience in the design, development, testing (TDD) and integration of high complex software solutions leveraging change management </li><li> 3 or more years of experience in full-stack development and designing loosely coupled API based systems </li><li> 3 or more years of experience designing and delivering Transactional, Warehouse, Analytical and Reporting Data Platforms leveraging modern cloud data technologies </li><li> 1 or more years of experience with Spark, SQL, data modeling, Java, and Spring Boot </li><li> 1 or more years of proven experience in an Agile/Scrum team environment </li><li> 1 or more years of proven experience leveraging DevSecOps and lean development principles such as Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery </li><li> 1 or more years of experience in cloud development with the AWS platform </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><strong>What Makes You Stand Out</strong></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Capable of collaborating with multiple business stakeholders to provide information technology solutions </li><li> Proven experience working in a team environment, influence effectively, ability to resolve impediments in a timely manner </li><li> Learning Agility / Innovative – desire and openness for continuous technical learning and identifying areas for application </li><li> Growth mindest – willingness to deal and thrive in uncertainty </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><strong>Education</strong></strong><p><br></p>Ideally, you will have a degree or equivalent related work experience in the following:<p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree in IT, Computer Science or Engineering </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You'll Get</strong><p><br></p>At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go while working in an inclusive team environment. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to think outside the box and the advanced tools and technology that foster innovation and achievement. Additionally, we offer a comprehensive reward package to help you get started on your new career path, including:<p><br></p><ul><li>Flexible work arrangements</li><li>Highly competitive base pay and performance bonuses</li><li>Savings &amp; Retirement benefits (401K and Defined Benefit Pension)</li><li>Healthcare benefits with a generous company contribution in the Health Savings Account</li><li>Adoption assistance</li><li>Employee Assistance Programs</li><li>Tuition assistance</li><li>Fitness subsidies and on-site gyms at specific Deere locations</li><li>Charitable contribution match</li><li>Employee Purchase Plan &amp; numerous discount programs for personal use</li></ul><p><br></p>Follow this link to learn more about our Total Rewards Package https://bit.ly/3XCd8fL<p><br></p>The information contained herein is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and qualifications required of individuals performing the job. The qualifications detailed in this job description are not considered the minimum requirements necessary to perform the job, but rather as guidelines.<p><br></p>The terms of the applicable benefit plans, and all company actions administering or interpreting these plans, continue to control. Deere &amp; Company reserves the right to suspend, amend, modify, or terminate the Plan(s) in any manner at any time, including the right to modify or eliminate any cost-sharing between the company and participants. Changes, which can be made at any time, are made by action of the company's board of directors, or to the extent authorized by resolution of its board of directors, or by the Deere &amp; Company Compensation Committee. In the event of a conflict between the language of the official Plan Documents and this document, the language of the official Plan Documents will control.<p><br></p>ACA Section 1557 Nondiscrimination Notice<p><br></p>The John Deere Health Benefit Plans for Salaried Employees and The John Deere Benefit Plan for Wage Employees comply with applicable Federal civil rights laws and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, disability, or sex.

title: Junior Back End / Full Stack Developer
description: SYNERGISTICIT is aware that the Job Market is Challenging because of Tech Layoffs due to which The Job market is flooded with hundreds and thousands of laid off Jobseekers who are competing with existing Jobseekers. For entry level Job seekers to get client interviews and jobs they need to differentiate themselves by ensuring they have exceptional skills and technologies to be noticed by clients.<p><br></p>Since 2010 we have helped Jobseekers differentiate themselves by providing the clients with candidates who have the requisite skills and experience to outperform at interviews and clients. Here at SynergisticIT We just don't focus on getting you a Job we make careers. All Positions are open for all visas and US citizens We at Synergisticit understand the problem of the mismatch between employer's requirements and Employee skills and that's why since 2010 we have helped thousands of candidates get jobs at technology clients like apple, google, Paypal, western union, Client, visa, walmart labs etc to name a few. We have an excellent reputation with the clients. Currently, We are looking for entry-level software programmers, Java Full stack developers, Python/Java developers, Data analysts/ Data Scientists, Machine Learning engineers. Who Should Apply Recent Computer science/Engineering /Mathematics/Statistics or Science Graduates looking to make their careers in IT Industry We welcome candidates with all visas and citizens to apply. We assist in filing for STEM extension and also for H1b and Green card filing to Candidates<p><br></p>We also offer Skill enhancement programs for candidates who are either missing skills or are lacking Industry/Client experience with Projects and skills. Candidates having difficulty in finding jobs or cracking interviews or who wants to improve their skill portfolio. If they are qualified with enough skills and have hands on project work at clients then no need for skill enhancement.<p><br></p>Candidates can benefit from skill enhancement if they fall into the below categories.<p><br></p>Candidates who Lack Experience or are freshers with No actual on Job experience with projects with clients Have had a break in careers Lack Technical Competency or skills being demanded by clients Different visa candidates (Like OPT/H4EAD/L2EAD )who want to get employed and settle down in the USA please check the below links to see success outcomes of our candidates https://www.synergisticit.com/candidate-outcomes/<p><br></p>Watch the below videos of us participating at Industry events with the Top companies in Technology at Oracle Cloud world /Oracle Java one (Las vegas) and at Gartner Data Analytics Summit (Florida)<p><br></p>Oracle CloudWorld Event (OCW) Las Vegas 2022 | SynergisticIT - YouTube https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OAFOhcGy9Z8<p><br></p>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EmO7NrWHkLM https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NVBU9RYZ6UI<p><br></p>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yy74yvjatVg SynergisticIT at Gartner Data and Analytics Summit 2023 - YouTube<p><br></p>https://www.synergisticit.com/java-track/ https://www.synergisticit.com/data-science-track/ https://www.synergisticit.com/contact-us/<p><br></p>If you have relevant skills and industry experience, please apply if not then candidates can opt for Skill enhancement.<p><br></p>For getting help with interviews please visit<p><br></p>https://www.synergisticit.com/interview-questions/<p><br></p><strong><u>REQUIRED SKILLS For Java /Software Programmers</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelors degree or Masters degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, IT</li><li> Highly motivated, self-learner, and technically inquisitive</li><li> Experience in programming language Java and understanding of the software development life cycle</li><li> Project work on the skills</li><li> Knowledge of Core Java , javascript , C++ or software programming</li><li> Spring boot, Microservices, Docker, Jenkins and REST API's experience</li><li> Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li></ul><p><br></p>For data Science/Machine learning<p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelors degree or Masters degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, IT</li><li> Project work on the technologies needed</li><li> Highly motivated, self-learner, and technically inquisitive</li><li> Experience in programming language Java and understanding of the software development life cycle</li><li> Knowledge of Statistics, SAS, Python, Computer Vision, data visualization tools</li><li> Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred skills: NLP, Text mining, Tableau, PowerBI, Time series analysis<p><br></p>Please understand skills and relevant experience on real world projects are required by clients for selection even if its Junior or entry level position the additional skills and Project work with hands on experience building projects at client site are the only way a candidate can be picked by clients. If not having the skills or hands on project work at client site then candidates can opt for skill enhancement to gain the required skills and project work. No third party candidates or c2c candidates<p><br></p>please only apply to the posting<p><br></p>No phone calls please. Shortlisted candidates would be reached out.

title: Software Engineer (Chicago, IL or Moline, IL)
description: <ul><li>LOOKING FOR A NEW LABVIEW OPPORTUNITY?</li><li>I have the one for YOU! My client manufactures Electronics and Telematics for the Automotive/Transportation industry. They are looking for a Tenured Test Engineer to help test the Electronics during and post manufacturing. You will be apart of the team that develops manufacturing tests performed on every unit that is built to make sure it is free of manufacturing flaws, focusing on manufacturing defects. You will be building a collection of instruments that takes measurements on the products. You will be working with the product designs in that phase to come up with the test requirements and then write the software to implement. You will control the software that you design and write the software to control instrumentation and the unit that we are testing.</li><li>Responsibilities:*</li><li>Quote, Design, and Develop manufacturing test solutions for New Product Introduction</li><li>Develop software (C#, C, and NI TestStand) to control test instruments and Units Under Test in order to meet product test requirements</li><li>Demonstrate the ability to develop hardware and software for production test solutions</li><li>Experience interpreting MySQL database schema and writing database queries</li><li>Provide ongoing support for existing products related to ECOs, yield issues, reliability improvements, and other continuous improvement initiatives</li><li>Written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate with customers, suppliers, and internal project stakeholders</li><li>Manage project scopes and timelines and coordinate initiatives with Project Managers</li><li>Collaborate with Production Engineers and Supervisors to integrate test systems into the production process</li><li>Analyze test performance data and use production personnel input to drive test improvements opportunities</li><li>Ability to develop and interpret test requirements and identify test equipment required to meet those requirements</li><li>Ability to identify, assess, and resolve hardware and software issues</li><li>Compile and interpret Gage R&amp;R and Cpk studies</li><li>Support Root Cause Analysis of field return issues and implement additional test coverage as needed</li><li>Create documentation describing test design concepts and operator instructions</li><li>Experience related to manufacturing Printed Circuit Board Assemblies</li><li>Participate in peer reviews of test solutions</li><li>Skills:* *</li><li>Labview - Top Skill*</li><li>C# - Or other Object oriented languages within test and instrumentation</li><li>Test Stand</li><li>SQL or MySQL</li><li>Manufacturing Test</li><li>Test Automation</li><li>Test development/design</li><li>Test procedure</li><li>Hardware</li><li>Debug</li><li>Test Fixture</li><li>Production</li><li>Manufacturing</li><li>Lab</li><li>Validation</li><li>Test plan</li><li>Test engineering</li><li>Electrical</li><li>Test equipment</li><li>Write test scripts</li><li>Experience developing tests for RF or wireless devices (i.e. Cellular, GPS, Bluetooth, WiFi)</li><li>Automotive is a plus but not required</li><li>Employee Perks:*</li><li>Paid Weekly</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plans</li><li>Abenity Discount Program</li><li>Udemy Courses</li><li>Work Life Balance</li><li>Experience Level:* 5+ years experience<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.
description_json: <ul><li>LOOKING FOR A NEW LABVIEW OPPORTUNITY?</li><li>I have the one for YOU! My client manufactures Electronics and Telematics for the Automotive/Transportation industry. They are looking for a Tenured Test Engineer to help test the Electronics during and post manufacturing. You will be apart of the team that develops manufacturing tests performed on every unit that is built to make sure it is free of manufacturing flaws, focusing on manufacturing defects. You will be building a collection of instruments that takes measurements on the products. You will be working with the product designs in that phase to come up with the test requirements and then write the software to implement. You will control the software that you design and write the software to control instrumentation and the unit that we are testing.</li><li>Responsibilities:*</li><li>Quote, Design, and Develop manufacturing test solutions for New Product Introduction</li><li>Develop software (C#, C, and NI TestStand) to control test instruments and Units Under Test in order to meet product test requirements</li><li>Demonstrate the ability to develop hardware and software for production test solutions</li><li>Experience interpreting MySQL database schema and writing database queries</li><li>Provide ongoing support for existing products related to ECOs, yield issues, reliability improvements, and other continuous improvement initiatives</li><li>Written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate with customers, suppliers, and internal project stakeholders</li><li>Manage project scopes and timelines and coordinate initiatives with Project Managers</li><li>Collaborate with Production Engineers and Supervisors to integrate test systems into the production process</li><li>Analyze test performance data and use production personnel input to drive test improvements opportunities</li><li>Ability to develop and interpret test requirements and identify test equipment required to meet those requirements</li><li>Ability to identify, assess, and resolve hardware and software issues</li><li>Compile and interpret Gage R&amp;R and Cpk studies</li><li>Support Root Cause Analysis of field return issues and implement additional test coverage as needed</li><li>Create documentation describing test design concepts and operator instructions</li><li>Experience related to manufacturing Printed Circuit Board Assemblies</li><li>Participate in peer reviews of test solutions</li><li>Skills:* *</li><li>Labview - Top Skill*</li><li>C# - Or other Object oriented languages within test and instrumentation</li><li>Test Stand</li><li>SQL or MySQL</li><li>Manufacturing Test</li><li>Test Automation</li><li>Test development/design</li><li>Test procedure</li><li>Hardware</li><li>Debug</li><li>Test Fixture</li><li>Production</li><li>Manufacturing</li><li>Lab</li><li>Validation</li><li>Test plan</li><li>Test engineering</li><li>Electrical</li><li>Test equipment</li><li>Write test scripts</li><li>Experience developing tests for RF or wireless devices (i.e. Cellular, GPS, Bluetooth, WiFi)</li><li>Automotive is a plus but not required</li><li>Employee Perks:*</li><li>Paid Weekly</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plans</li><li>Abenity Discount Program</li><li>Udemy Courses</li><li>Work Life Balance</li><li>Experience Level:* 5+ years experience<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Test Engineer
description: <strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Perkins Coie, we look for self-motivated individuals, dedicated to providing value and superior service, and above all, have a high degree of integrity and enthusiasm for their work. We have created a company culture based on collaboration, devotion to serving our clients, and mutual respect. Perkins Coie is committed to advancing diversity and inclusion both within the firm and throughout our collective communities. Work with one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For and receive great health insurance, tuition reimbursement, and paid sabbaticals.<p><br></p><strong>GENERAL PURPOSE</strong><p><br></p>The Microsoft Collaboration Solutions Engineer will help drive our platform strategy for our Microsoft SharePoint, Teams, and Power platforms. The engineer will design, develop, maintain, and support the firm’s Microsoft 365 (M365) platform including SharePoint Online, SharePoint Server 2016, Teams, Power Apps/Automate, and associated third-party applications. This includes developing and supporting custom solutions built on the M365 platforms. The engineer will work closely with business stakeholders to understand their requirements, assess feasibility, and if necessary, collaborate with other platform owners to develop a solution. The engineer will work collaboratively with others within the Technology Department to ensure the platform is managed in accordance with the firm’s standards for data and security.<p><br></p><strong>Essential Functions</strong><p><br></p>These essential functions are primary job duties that incumbents must be able to perform unassisted or with some reasonable accommodation.<p><br></p><ul><li>Act as the platform owner for SharePoint, Teams, and Power Automate. This includes establishing roadmaps, administering and maintaining the platform, managing security, and resolving issues.</li><li>Use, maintain, and support third-party applications such as Aderant Handshake, ShareGate, and Intapp Workspaces (Resptor) that are used to extend and support the platform.</li><li>Partner with the Technology Department and business leadership to identify priorities and project initiatives consistent with the firm’s strategic plan and roadmaps.</li><li>Work with all levels of the business to understand and assess their business requirements and determine the optimal, cost-effective solution consistent with their requirements. This may not always be the M365 platform.</li><li>Assist with the administration, maintenance, and support of the firm intranet.</li><li>Create technical documentation for solutions and procedures.</li><li>Stay current on M365 capabilities and roadmap by regularly engaging with Microsoft, attending seminars, training, etc.</li><li>Perform other duties, as assigned.</li><li>Be present at work during regularly scheduled working hours and as needed in the position, consistent with the firm’s attendance expectations.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>TRAVEL</strong><p><br></p>This position may require occasional travel to Perkins Coie offices, vendors, or conferences.<p><br></p><strong>Specific Skills Required</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience building SharePoint applications including web parts, workflows, and third-party interfaces.</li><li>Advanced knowledge of using the M365 platform to produce practical solutions for business needs.</li><li>Strong technical problem-solving that can adeptly administer, support, and maintain a hybrid (on-premises and cloud) SharePoint system.</li><li>Advanced knowledge of SharePoint security including permissions and guest access management.</li><li>Ability to create and debug automated workflows using Power Automate.</li><li>Ability to create and debug Power Apps solutions.</li><li>Strong SharePoint PowerShell module experience.</li><li>Working knowledge of Microsoft SQL. Ability to create stored procedures.</li><li>Comprehensive understanding of web technologies. Knowledge level must be appropriate for both troubleshooting and administration of SharePoint.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Specific Skills Preferred</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience building and supporting Power Apps solutions.</li><li>Experience with interfacing M365 with ServiceNow.</li><li>Working knowledge of HTML5, JavaScript, and CSS.</li><li>Knowledge of performance tuning and monitoring techniques.</li><li>Experience with SSO, Okta preferred.</li><li>Experience integrating with Azure resources.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education And Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Five plus years of experience developing and supporting SharePoint Server 2016 solutions.</li><li>Two plus years of experience developing and supporting SharePoint Online solutions.</li><li>Two plus years of experience developing and supporting Microsoft Teams solutions.</li></ul><p><br></p><em>This position is eligible for an annual discretionary bonus, 401(k) plan, medical, dental, and vision insurance, accrued paid time off plan starting at 20 days annually, personal medical and parental leave, up to ten paid Holidays, and family care benefits. More information regarding benefits and programs may be found</em><em> here</em><em>.</em><p><br></p><em>Perkins Coie encourages all interested applicants located near any of our office locations to apply</em><em>. This position may be filled in the following location(s). The compensation depends on qualifications and experience.</em><p><br></p><em>Colorado compensation range: $86,480 to $135,360 annually</em><p><br></p><em>Los Angeles compensation range: $100,710 to $157,640 annually</em><p><br></p><em>San Diego compensation range: $99,430 to $155,640 annually</em><p><br></p><em>Washington State compensation range: $91,220 to $142,790 annually</em><p><br></p>#TechDept<p><br></p>

The compensation depends on qualifications and experience.</em><p><br></p><em>Colorado compensation range: $86,480 to $135,360 annually</em><p><br></p><em>Los Angeles compensation range: $100,710 to $157,640 annually</em><p><br></p><em>San Diego compensation range: $99,430 to $155,640 annually</em><p><br></p><em>Washington State compensation range: $91,220 to $142,790 annually</em><p><br></p>#TechDept<p><br></p>

title: Test Engineer
description: <strong>SUMMARY:<br><br></strong>The Endpoint Engineer is a key member of the Endpoint Management team at Winston &amp; Strawn, an international law firm with more than 900 attorneys in 16 offices around the world. The Endpoint Management team is responsible for the development, deployment, maintenance and support of the firm's physical and virtual desktop environments and mobile devices, as well as the technologies used to manage these platforms.<br><br>This engineering role is responsible for the administration and day-to-day operations of the firm's user-facing systems, including hardware selection; operating system imaging, configuration, and certification; inventory availability or capacity planning; application deployment and security policy compliance, all with the end goal of delivering a stable, reliable, and elegant computing environment.<br><br>The Endpoint Engineer will be the owner of one or more of the firm's management solutions (Microsoft Intune, Endpoint Manager, Citrix Cloud, etc.), and will be responsible for keeping pace with the firm's continued investment in leading-edge technologies to deliver, configure and secure access to the firm's cloud-based and on-prem systems.<br><br>The Endpoint Engineer will leverage the firm's monitoring and analytics software to proactively identify issues and trends that impact user satisfaction and productivity, and will make recommendations on new technologies, services, and practices to deliver an exceptional user experience for the firm's attorneys and staff.<br><br><strong>DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:<br><br></strong>This role includes defining, building, and operating solutions for the firm's end-user compute environments. Responsibilities include:<br><br><ul><li>Participating in the evaluation and definition of the User Experience, specifying standards for how applications and desktops should perform, anticipating user interaction with upgrades and patch management, optimizing user interfaces, and ensuring intuitive, elegant system design and optimal supportability.</li><li>Defining procedures for imaging desktop and laptop hardware, including evaluation and testing of BIOS version, BIOS configuration and device drivers, and virtual machines, including virtual hardware specifications.</li><li>Assisting in the planning and execution of upgrade cycles for the Windows OS, major core applications, and other enterprise applications.</li><li>Working with the firm's Enterprise Applications, IT Operations, and Risk teams to define and evolve new ways of delivering applications to any device.</li><li>Defining and implementing standard policies, procedures, and processes for endpoint device management, including operating system and application deployment, application packaging and configuration, and the securing of the environment against the installation or execution of unapproved applications.</li><li>Assisting in the vulnerability management efforts of the firm following the standards set by the firm's Information Risk Management team, including the deployment of security patches using an enterprise patch management solution and the configuration of security controls such as AppLocker application whitelisting, NTFS permissions, and Windows Firewall rules.</li><li>Demonstrating expert-level proficiency with key technologies to be supported, including willingness and ability to develop expertise in new technologies as needed.</li><li>Driving innovation and continuous improvement of the end user computing environment. </li><li>Evaluating the impact of relevant emerging technology and business trends.</li><li>Providing technical and operational governance across the firm's end-user computing environment.</li><li>Offering excellent third-tier knowledge and support to first- and second-tier technical support analysts during issue escalation, coordinating problem evaluation and troubleshooting efforts with other IS staff.</li><li>Recommending and supporting new tools, techniques, and technologies for workstation and mobile device management.<br><br></li></ul><strong>BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:<br><br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology or 5 + years equivalent work experience required.</li><li>5+ years of IT Infrastructure or desktop experience creating or maintaining enterprise level systems, management and or architecture, ideally in a multi-domain, multi-datacenter environment required.</li><li>Must have “hands-on” experience with Windows and Citrix management technologies (Active Directory, SCCM, XenApp/XenDesktop).</li><li>Must be certified in, or actively pursuing a certification in, at least one of the core management technologies.<br><br></li></ul><strong>ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:<br><br></strong><ul><li>5+ years of engineering experience with Windows 10, Windows Server 2016, Office 365, SCCM, Mac OSX, Apple iOS, and Android.</li><li>Strong working knowledge of automation and scripting (PowerShell and/or Python).</li><li>Exceptional interpersonal, leadership, and organizational skills, with the ability to schedule and coordinate multiple activities in results-oriented environment.</li><li>Effective communication skills, both written and oral.</li><li>Must have customer service attitude and ability to work well with other groups.</li><li>Must subscribe to being highly available and responsive to occasional after-hours issues, as the firm operates on a near 24x7 basis.</li><li>Experience in the legal market a plus.<br><br></li></ul>We value diversity in the workplace. EOE/Minorities/Females/Vets/Disabled (EOE=Equal Opportunity Employer)<br><br>

title: Salesforce Architect Healthcare Remote
description: <strong>Cliecon Solutions Inc,</strong> (head quartered in central NJ ) is one of the fastest growing and a leading consulting and management firm with 12 years of experience in Staff Augmentation. We handle complete recruiting cycle for fortune 500 clients, major implementing partners and tier -1 vendors. We specialized in recruiting for Application development, Big data, Databases, Infrastructure, Cloud, Mobile and ERP based solutions projects.<p><br></p><strong>Job Title: </strong><strong>Linux</strong> <strong>Engineer</strong><p><br></p><strong>Location: </strong><strong>Chicago, IL(Onsite)</strong><p><br></p><strong>Duration: Long Term</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>8 plus years of Linux Patching along with Apache Tomcat</li><li>We need resource in Chicago with close proximity to our YASH office and need to travel to customer site in case of critical break fix during the patching window/cycle.</li></ul> Linux Engineer / Middleware on W2 (Chicago, IL)

title: Microsoft Collaboration Solutions Engineer
description: <strong>AEM Full Stack Engineer<br><br></strong><strong><u>Global Hospitality Company<br><br></u></strong><strong>Remote<br><br></strong><strong>$56 - $65 / HR<br><br></strong><strong>6 months duration<br><br></strong>We are looking for a AEM Full Stack Engineer to join a small but motivated team focused on designing and delivering a cutting edge marketing technology stack<br><br><strong><u>Position Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>The AEM Full Stack Engineer is responsible for designing and building next generation marketing technology personalization and content delivery solution. This will involve<br><ul><li> Building new application components and templates to enable delivery of personalized omni channel content, analysis of requirements, component design, development of the code, and testing of programs and interfaces.</li><li> Designing, implementing and configuring Remote Adobe AEM Assets</li><li> Building and integrating headless content-driven applications on top of AEMs core platform and integrate with AWS cloud network hosted solutions</li><li> Modifying existing application code or interfaces in addition to monitoring code-base</li><li> Providing AEM cloud infrastructure support, content problem resolution, and content publishing</li><li> Building AEM component client library java scripts and css designs</li><li> Developing new user experience features following distributed component model</li><li> Building omni channel reusable code and libraries</li><li> Ensuring the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs working closely with product dev teams</li><li> Optimizing UX/UI for maximum speed and scalability<br></li></ul><strong><u>Experience And Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> 11+ years’ experience in Web Development technologies (Java, HTML/DHTML, XML, JavaScript, web services)</li><li> 7+ years’ experience in Adobe Experience Manager</li><li> Advanced knowledge of Adobe AEM (AEM 6.5 on cloud preferred)</li><li> Deep knowledge of AEM cloud configurations, editable templates, dynamic components and MSM</li><li> Deep knowledge or AEM core components, HTL/Sightly and ACS components</li><li> Deep knowledge of AEM Archetypes</li><li> Proven skills in designing, developing, and supporting AEM components, integrations, and applications; building and integrating to external end points through OSGi bundles and services</li><li> Strong experience in Front end templates with handlebars management and/or similar templates<br></li></ul>Deep knowledge AEM DAM, inbuilt and remote.<br><ul><li> Knowledge of Java Content Repository (JCR), RESTful web services, JSON structures, Sling Servlets</li><li> Proficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3</li><li> Deep knowledge of Coral UI Java script libraries</li><li> Good understanding of JS/CSS integration in to CMS systems (AEM experience preferred)</li><li> Deep knowledge of converting third party wire frames to CMS HTML components</li><li> Good understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as PostCSS and SASS</li><li> Create REST API documentation using Swagger and YAML or similar tools<br></li></ul>#PCIT #Hospitality<br><br>

title: Endpoint Engineer (Hybrid)
description: We are seeking a dynamic and talented Salesforce Architect to join our high-growth healthcare system. As the primary Salesforce Architect, you will play a crucial role in shaping our Salesforce implementations and working with cutting-edge tools, languages, and systems. If you are passionate about healthcare and thrive in an innovative environment, this is the perfect opportunity for you!<br><br><strong><u>What You'll Do<br><br></u></strong>Own architecture responsibilities and collaborate with a team of Architects, Engineers, and Analysts to ensure the successful implementation of critical systems on Salesforce platforms.<br><br>Define and implement Salesforce solutions that seamlessly integrate with our hospital systems.<br><br>Develop a deep understanding of system integrations and data relationships across various platforms.<br><br>Lead multiple projects aimed at implementing enterprise-wide Salesforce platforms.<br><br>Create innovative business logic within Salesforce implementations.<br><br>Customize Salesforce platforms to meet specific business requirements and enterprise needs.<br><br><strong><u>What You'll Need<br><br></u></strong>Core Qualifications:<br><br>A minimum of 8 years of experience in defining, architecting, and delivering Salesforce solutions.<br><br>At least 2 years of experience working in a hospital or Medical Center environment.<br><br>Proven expertise in Salesforce platforms, including Salesforce Health Cloud, Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC), and/or Salesforce Sales and Service Cloud. Experience with Salesforce Health Cloud is a must.<br><br>Strong command of Salesforce languages and frameworks, such as Apex, Visualforce, and SOQL.<br><br>A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent work experience.<br><br><strong><u>What You'll Get<br><br></u></strong>At [Company Name], you will have the opportunity to be part of one of the nation's top healthcare institutions. Joining our team means not only discovering a fulfilling career but also immersing yourself in a culture that has gained national recognition. We foster innovation, collaboration, accountability, respect, and excellence, making a positive impact on both our employees and the people we serve.<br><br>We value the health, security, and happiness of our employees, and that's why we offer some of the most comprehensive employee benefits in the industry. At [Company Name], we believe in equal opportunity and diversity in employment, creating an inclusive and empowering work environment.<br><br>Employment Type: Full-Time<br><br>Salary: $ 125,000.00 150,000.00 Per Year

title: AEM Developer
description: <strong><u>General Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Provide direct one-on-one instruction using principles of applied behavior analysis in a clinic, home, residential or school setting.<p><br></p>IABA is looking for <strong>Part-Time</strong> Behavior Therapists to serve children the population of children with Autism using ABA therapy.<p><br></p>Part-time positions currently available. Evening hours (3-8pm) available based on candidate availability and client need. One weekend day also required for both part-time and full-time positions.<p><br></p><ul><li>SIGN ON BONUS of $150.00 after 90 days of employment. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Essential Job Functions</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Implementation of goals and teaching plans created by the Behavior Analyst</li><li>Data collection related to the goals and behavior plans</li><li>Electronic filing of data and clinical documentation within a 24 hour timeframe</li><li>Attend mandatory trainings conducted by Instructional ABA Consultants</li><li>Proactively communicate with Behavior Analyst and Program Manager</li><li>Maintain confidentiality, ethical guidelines, policies including HIPPA laws and regulations</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Exposure to psychology, human development, or behavior analysis preferred</li><li>Minimum education required is a high school diploma or equivalent.</li><li>Strong verbal, written and communication skills</li><li>Strong work ethic with the ability to meet scheduling commitments</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Desired Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Prefer candidates working toward a bachelors or masters level program</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Must pass a background check</li><li>First Aid/CPR training preferred</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>WORK STATUS</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>This is a part time position</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>TRAVEL</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>100% travel between clients home and required meetings</li><li>Must have a valid driver's license and provide proof of auto insurance</li><li>Multiple locations: Evanston, Glenview, North Chicago</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>REPORTING</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Reports to Behavior Analyst and Program Manager</li></ul>

From job search to upskilling portfolio and interview preparation, we can guide you at every step of your career.<br><br>SynergisticIT spares no efforts to connect you with a large network of tech giants, including Google, Apple, PayPal, Dell, Cisco, Client, etc. Presently, we are actively looking for Full stack developer (Remote) with a driven mindset. title: Toshiba Developer
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote-United States only (TimeZone: PST/CIST | Full day overlap)</li><li>HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $115 – $135/hr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Short term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>About The Role<br></strong><ul><li>Design, Analyze and Propose metrics to measure projects impact and opportunity sizing in eCommerce Search Scenario.</li><li>Extract insights from data for improving current Machine learning ranking models that optimize for various business goals to power search at scale.</li><li>Prototype, optimize, and productionize large-scale product improvements that deliver key results.</li><li>Run A/B experiments to validate product improvements.</li><li>PrePost Analysis on A/B experiments</li><li>Work closely with software engineers, applied scientists, product managers, and designers.</li><li>Of course, this is just a sample of the kinds of work this role will require! You should assume that your role will encompass other tasks, too, and that your job duties and responsibilities may change from time to time at company's discretion, or otherwise applicable with local law.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Requirements<br></strong><ul><li>Supporting teams with data &amp; analysis: you will work with multidisciplinary teams (marketing, product, etc.) to provide insights and analytical support when needed; you will also distill insights and make recommendations backed up by data to relevant stakeholders growing our business.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Must-Haves<br></strong><ul><li>Strong SQL skills and experience with large datasets</li><li>Proficiency in Python, Scala, or similar languages</li><li>Experience with data visualization tools</li><li>Ability to communicate complex issues simply to diverse stakeholders</li><li>Master's degree in Statistics, Data Analytics, Computer Science or related field</li><li>Analytical thinking, problem-solving skills, and a passion for numbers</li><li>Proficient written communication in a remote team setting, familiarity with Slack and Google Docs</li><li>Eagerness to learn, natural curiosity, and attention to detail</li><li>Ability to take on and lead unconstrained problems and know when to seek help and how to deliver.</li><li>Strong written communication skills.<br><br></li></ul>Nice-to-Haves<br><ul><li>Experience in neural ML frameworks such as PyTorch, Keras, Tensorflow.</li><li>Have solid software engineering and coding skills, including CS fundamentals like data structures and algorithms.</li><li>Have experience working on large-scale, low-latency distributed systems. </li><li>Research skills to transform business challenges into machine learning tasks effectively. A proven track record in utilizing machine learning approaches to solve real-world problems.</li><li>Experience with / working in one of the following fields: deep learning, uplift modeling, fairness in recommender systems, reinforcement learning. </li></ul> <strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong><strong>About The Team<br><br></strong>The Marketplace Optimization team is a part of the Search and Ads group, who are committed to refining search ranking quality for both buyers and sellers. We are responsible for the third path ranking of search results, which significantly shapes the overall customer search experience. The team is an eclectic mix of machine learning engineers, applied scientists, and a product manager. Collaborating intensively with software engineers and various product and enablement teams throughout the organization, we are involved in the creation and execution of advanced machine learning algorithms that consistently facilitate improved search results.<br><ul><li>We value respect, collaboration, and customer focus.</li><li>We believe in encouraging an inclusive and supportive environment where everyone's ideas are heard and valued.</li><li>We also believe in working closely with other teams and sharing ideas and insights to help drive innovation across the organization.</li><li>And above all, we are passionate about delivering value to our customers and improving their search experience.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6642<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Python Software Engineer (Backend)
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Direct Hire/ FTE Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote - United States only (TimeZone: CST, EST, MST, PST/CIST | Full day overlap)</li><li>SALARY RANGE: $150,000 – $220,000/yr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40hr/week - Long term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br><br></strong><strong>Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Track record of building highly performant, highly observable, and highly scalable systems.</li><li>5+ years of experience building scalable distributed systems.</li><li>Experience with streaming technologies (Pub/Sub, Kafka, RabbitMQ, etc).</li><li>Experience with various data storage solutions (SQL, NoSQL / key-value stores).<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Candidate is in either NY, Bay Area, or SoCal. Team is fully remote, however we meet frequently within these regions.</li><li>2+ years of experience in an early-stage startup.</li><li>3+ years of experience in leading teams either as a Technical Lead or Engineering Manager.</li><li>Proven track record migrating systems in a changing environment that allows for little to no downtime to meet increasing demand.</li><li>Obsessed about your craft and share your knowledge (tech talks, articles, open source, etc).</li><li>Experience in working in Python/strongly typed languages.</li></ul> <strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong><strong>About Us<br><br></strong>Harmonic is using data and AI to map the world of startups. When companies are first formed, they’re invisible to the world. We help those who serve them find them first, to provide the right capital, products and talent at the right time.<br><br>Today, we’re honored to have some of the leading firms and companies depend on harmonic.ai as their source of startup data. Firms like Accel, NEA, Brex, Notion, and Google Ventures to connect startups with the capital and resources that they need to drive growth. We’re backed by some of the best investors too, who started their journey with us as customers: Craft, Sozo, Floodgate, and Index’s scout fund (~$30M raised 💰).<br><br>We believe that your rate of learning and improving is more important than where you are today. And we invite you to reach out if you’re driven, curious, optimistic, and passionate about mastering your craft, regardless of your background!<br><br><strong>The role<br><br></strong>Before reading further, take a look at our cultural values and see if being part of <strong>Philharmonic Orchestra</strong> resonates with you!<br><br>We are looking for an engineer to join our team and help us unlock the full potential of our most critical asset: our data. You will have direct impact on our revenue and delivering value to our customers by ensuring that our systems can handle the complex relationship between our entities.<br><br>As the leader of our engineering efforts, you will be responsible for scaling our knowledge graph infrastructure and managing our time series data. You will also evaluate and improve our data storage and taxonomy systems, and mentor and manage other engineers on the team.<br><br>We are looking for someone who is constantly looking for ways to increase the effectiveness of the team through the use of technology, and who shares our values of being low ego, obsessed, curious, and collaborative. If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you!<br><br><strong>What You Will Do<br></strong><ul><li>Derive deeper insight from our data by scaling our current knowledge graph infrastructure to handle hundreds of millions of startup related data.</li><li>Deeply understand how our insight layer is connected to the rest of our application layer and ensure the needs of our customers as well as our teams are met by focusing on performance, observability, and most importantly customer demand.</li><li>Evaluate how we store time series data and help us scale it 10x the current throughput in an iterative manner.</li><li>Leverage ML infrastructure and services to continually improve our taxonomy and derive relevant signals from the underlying data.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6683<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Behavior Therapist
description: <p><span>Headquartered in Dublin, Ohio, Cardinal Health, Inc. (NYSE: CAH) is a global, integrated healthcare services and products company connecting patients, providers, payers, pharmacists and manufacturers for integrated care coordination and better patient management. Backed by nearly 100 years of experience, with more than 50,000 employees in nearly 60 countries, Cardinal Health ranks among the top 20 on the Fortune 500.</span>  </p><p>We currently have a full-time job opening for an Application Security Engineer. </p><p></p><p><strong>Department overview:</strong> </p><p></p><p>The Information Security organization is on a tremendous growth journey.  We aim to be a world-class cybersecurity organization that enables Cardinal Health to be healthcare’s most trusted partner.  We boast tremendous opportunities to grow and apply technical skills to meet organizational needs, empowering talented engineers who mentor and uplift others, led by leaders with a maniacal focus on employee development and well-being, dedicated training programs, and a fun, collaborative atmosphere. </p><p></p><p>As a part of our growth, we are investing heavily in Application Security to enable the enterprise to deliver products and services to our customers with security in mind. Traditionally Application Security was a function of Security Architecture. This new team’s sole function is dedicated to Application Security and is being created to reflect its importance to our organization. </p><p></p><p><strong>Job Overview:</strong> </p><p></p><p>The Application Security Analyst is a foundational member of the new Application Security team at Cardinal Health. This engineer blends extensive Software Development experience with a strong Information Security background to serve Cardinal Health's best interests by balancing security with software delivery.  <span>This role will be focused on Product Ownership and Business Analyst functions within an Application Security Team. </span></p><p></p><p><em><span>What is expected of you and others at this level</span></em></p><ul><li><span>Applies</span> advanced knowledge and understanding of concepts, principles, and technical capabilities to manage a wide variety of projects</li><li><span>Participates</span> in the development of policies and procedures to achieve specific goals</li><li><span>Recommends</span> new practices, processes, metrics, or models</li><li><span>Works</span> on or may lead complex projects of large scope</li><li><span>Projects</span> may have significant and long-term impact</li><li><span>Provides</span> solutions which may set precedent</li><li><span>Independently</span> determines method for completion of new projects</li><li><span>Receives</span> guidance on overall project objectives</li><li><span>Acts</span> as a mentor to less experienced colleagues</li></ul><p></p><p><em>Desired Skills/Experience:</em></p><ul><li>Good understanding of Application Security Concepts</li><li>Security related experience, working with application/software development teams, promoting continuous improvement, problem solving skills.</li><li>Experience writing requirements or user stories for the development of new features, enhancements to existing features, etc.</li><li>Ability to work with team and help prioritize the requirements strategically</li><li>Good Presentation and communication Skills.</li></ul><p></p><p><strong>Qualifications:</strong> </p><p><em>Required Qualifications</em></p><ul><li>Proven experience with one or more of the following development languages/platforms: Java, JavaScript, .NET/C#, Python, PHP/Laravel or CodeIgniter</li><li>Proven understanding of Application Security concepts</li></ul><p></p><p><em>Preferred Qualifications</em></p><ul><li>Understanding and previous experience in one or more of the following preferred: <ul><li>SDLC and DevSecOps concepts such as CI/CD pipelines </li><li>Agile development concepts and methods such as Scrum or Kanban</li><li>Container concepts and technologies, including Docker and Kubernetes</li><li>OWASP Top 10</li><li>Static or Dynamic code scanning and subsequent remediations</li><li>Experience in understanding the SCA/SAST/DAST Scanning process.</li><li>Experience in understanding the scan results and share the tools agnostics to the application teams.</li><li>Experience in creating dashboards and guide the application teams through the remediation process.</li><li>Experience in Veracode a Plus.</li><li>Common application security controls, including WAF </li><li>Common patterns for AuthN and AuthZ </li></ul></li><li>One or more Information Security Certifications preferred: CISSP, CSSLP, CISM, CCSP, GSLC, GSEC, CISA </li><li>Bachelor’s degree in related field, or equivalent work experience</li></ul><p><em>Candidates who are back-to-work, people with disabilities, without a college degree, and Veterans are encouraged to apply.</em></p><br><br><p><em>Cardinal Health supports an inclusive workplace that values diversity of thought, experience and background. We celebrate the power of our differences to create better solutions for our customers by ensuring employees can be their authentic selves each day. Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, veteran status, marital status, creed, status with regard to public assistance, genetic status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.</em></p>

title: Full stack developer (Remote)
description: <strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Perkins Coie, we look for individuals who are self-motivated, dedicated to providing value and superior service, and above all, have a high degree of integrity and enthusiasm for their work. We have created a company culture that is based on collaboration, devotion to serving our clients, and mutual respect. Perkins Coie is committed to advancing diversity and inclusion both within the firm and throughout our collective communities. Work for one of the 100 Best Workplaces in America. Get great health insurance, tuition reimbursement, and paid sabbaticals.<p><br></p><strong>GENERAL PURPOSE</strong><p><br></p>Perkins Coie LLP has an immediate opening for a Software Developer to serve as a member of the ServiceNow team. This role will work with IT service owners, process owners, and various service delivery groups to develop technical solutions that satisfy the business needs of Perkins Coie.<p><br></p><strong>Essential Functions</strong><p><br></p>The following essential functions are primary job duties that incumbents must be able to perform unassisted or with some reasonable accommodation.<p><br></p><ul><li>Development: Follow documented procedures to complete application or system-level changes and upgrades. Develop, configure, and customize ServiceNow applications and services. Ensure tool configuration consistency across development and production environments. Support the entire development lifecycle and integrate ServiceNow applications with other programs. </li><li>Test &amp; Deployment: Follow and perform tests to ensure appropriate implementation of new changes and upgrades. Perform code reviews to ensure that the quality bar is being met regarding coding standards, integration, extensibility, and security. Create and review test plans to assure business workflow and reporting meet requirements when implemented.</li><li>End User Support: Assists the platform administrator with incident resolution. Manage and escalate issues to the service management vendor when appropriate. Troubleshoot bugs, fix defects, and support users of applications developed by the enterprise application development team. Build and maintain effective working relationships with users and peers and work effectively in a team environment.</li><li>Professional Development: Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reading articles and publications, and attending user groups.</li><li>Perform other duties, as assigned. </li><li>Be present at work during regularly scheduled working hours and as needed in the position, consistent with the firm’s attendance expectations.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Specific Skills Required</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Working knowledge of the ServiceNow modules including IT Service Management (ITSM) of incidents, requests, changes, problems, and CSM</li><li>Working knowledge of networking in a Microsoft Windows environment including client/server and web technologies</li><li>Working knowledge of Web Technologies (XML, HTML, JavaScript, Web Services, etc.) and of working in a SaaS environment</li><li>Experience in developing integrations between ServiceNow and other systems via APIs</li><li>Strong oral and written communication skills</li><li>Ability to exercise good judgment in prioritizing multiple tasks and addressing problems while under time and resource constraints</li><li>Being a self-starter with strong time management skills, attention to detail, and a commitment to quality</li><li>Experience with ITSM dashboard design</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Specific Skills Preferred</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>General understanding of the applications and business workflows of law firms</li><li>Working knowledge of IT asset management (SAM and Hardware), configuration management database (CMDB), and IT operations management modules</li><li>Understanding of ITSM lifecycle workflows and Service Management Integration</li><li>Understanding of Agile methodologies (Scrum)</li><li>Experience writing PowerShell scripts</li><li>Experience with data analysis and reporting</li><li>Experience with the ITIL Framework</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education And Experience</strong><p><br></p>2-3 years of related Applications Support/Administration or Analysis experience. 3-5 years’ experience developing in ServiceNow. title: Data Scientist - Freelance [Remote]
description: <strong>We are looking for a mid-level / junior engineer with 1-3 years of experience. You will be joining a small team of software engineers who are responsible for the full life cycle development of a best in class suite of tools utilized by a world renowned financial services firm. In this role, you will be interacting with numerous business units - including from locations across the country - to ensure the systems are developed in the best way possible. We look for people who are confident decision makers, able to communicate their ideas effectively, and understand both urgency in delivering while not compromising code quality. <br><br></strong><strong>We are conveniently located just blocks from the Chicago Metra stations with unbeatable views of the city. We offer a very competitive comp package including top tier benefits (Medical, 401K, PTO).<br></strong><ul><li>Sorry, we are unable to offer any sponsorship or visa transfers<br></li></ul><strong><u>Successful Candidates Will Possess Many Of The Following<br></u></strong><ul><li>Python (1 year)</li><li>C++ or C# (1 year)</li><li>JavaScript or React experience on the front-end</li><li>Financial industry experience (professional, internship, or a desire to work within the financial sector)<br></li></ul>
