title: Harmonic AI - Software Engineer - Direct Hire [Remote]
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Direct Hire/ FTE Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote - United States only (TimeZone: CST, EST, MST, PST/CIST | Full day overlap)</li><li>SALARY RANGE: $150,000 – $220,000/yr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40hr/week - Long term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br><br></strong><strong>Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Track record of building highly performant, highly observable, and highly scalable systems</li><li>5+ years of experience building scalable frontend and backend systems</li><li>Able to work across disciplines with minimum process to organize work and create predictability in an unpredictable space</li><li>Have experience taking the lead in planning and executing the development roadmap for software projects<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>2+ years of experience in an early-stage startup</li><li>Experience designing and implementing GraphQL APIs on top of large data sources</li><li>Experience implementing web applications that manage large amounts of data</li><li>Obsessed about your craft and share your knowledge (tech talks, articles, open source, side projects, etc.)</li><li>Experience working in Python/strongly typed languages</li></ul> <strong><strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong></strong><strong><strong>The role<br><br></strong></strong>Before reading further, take a look at our cultural values and see if it resonates with you!<br><br>You will work directly on the technology stack that enables our customers to discover startups. Your work will have a direct impact on revenue, customer engagement, and the overall customer experience. As a team member, you will take ownership of our API layer and help us improve its performance, observability, and developer productivity. You will also provide guidance to the current team on how to design systems from the frontend to the backend.<br><br>Our culture is one of low ego, obsession, curiosity, and collaboration. We value hard work and getting things done quickly. If this sounds like a good fit for you, apply now!<br><br><strong>What You Will Do<br></strong><ul><li>Lead the design of our GraphQL API layer, identify its bottlenecks, and make the team accountable by improving our observability and performance</li><li>Contribute to our search infrastructure (including but not limited to enabling rapid iteration and field management in our search stack and improving end-to-end search schema modeling and query parsing to improve performance in our application)</li><li>Identify the core issues in our frontend code and ensure it can support high-velocity feature development</li><li>Mentor existing engineers on the best way to write backend and frontend code by refactoring existing code and introducing new patterns when necessary</li><li>Contribute to our engineering culture by finding ways to help us be more customer-obsessed<br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6682<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Senior Analyst, Information Security & Risk
description: <strong>Summary<br><br></strong>This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and Web Services at scale. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.<br><br>Bring your Python and Golang skills to bear on identity, authorization and access management across Canonical's suite of enterprise products and web services.<br><br>As a software engineer for Identity Management products of Canonical, you will modernize and expand the capabilities of the identity management solutions we use for authentication and authorization in our products, as well as our canonical.com and ubuntu.com websites. Your work on Identity Management will directly impact the users of all Canonical products.<br><br>Technical excellence and a background in software engineering are necessary prerequisites for this role. You will be expected to own the design and delivery of the system, facilitate integrations and work with your team on strategy and execution.<br><br>What you'll do<br><ul><li>Collaborate proactively with a distributed team</li><li>Write clean web service APIs to support both CLI and web frontend clients, using Python (and optionally Golang). </li><li>Design and implement new features and enhancements from spec to production and ongoing operations at scale. </li><li>Review code produced by other engineers</li><li>Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions. </li><li>Create and enhance management, authentication and authorization API endpoints</li><li>Craft end-user authentication flows from design to implementation</li><li>Modernize the identity stack of our websites and products by driving adoption of best-of-breed IAM technologies </li><li>Deliver great products that users love by maintaining a culture of quality and engineering excellence</li><li>Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks per year for internal and external events<br><br></li></ul>Who you are<br><ul><li>You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree</li><li>You are a software engineer, with specific experience building identity and access management products </li><li>You are familiar with the open source software, standards, protocols and concepts in the identity space (e.g. OpenID, OAuth, LDAP)</li><li>You have experience implementing authorization frameworks in distributed systems</li><li>You value secure coding and standards, and enjoy working on teams that do the same</li><li>You have solid experience working in an agile development environment</li><li>You love technology and working with a diverse set of talented people. </li><li>You are comfortable with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform. </li><li>You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable</li><li>You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated</li><li>You love embracing new technologies and pushing the boundaries of what is possible, with a view to building products that improve how people operate software and infrastructure everywhere <br><br></li></ul><strong>About Canonical<br><br></strong>Canonical is a growing, international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu -- the world's #1 cloud operating system. Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu. Canonical is a unique tech company - global, remote-first, open source, with 700 professionals across 50 countries - we want to be the world's best, not biggest, global software company. With almost every team remote by default, Canonical sets the pace on the 21st-century digital workplace.<br><br>What Canonical offers:<br><ul><li>Work from home</li><li>Learning and development allowances</li><li>Competitive Salary</li><li>Annual compensation review</li><li>Recognition rewards</li><li>Generous annual leave</li><li>Paid maternity, paternity and sick leave</li><li>Priority Pass for travel</li><li>Exposure to international business and technology<br><br></li></ul><em>We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.<br><br></em>#stack<br><br>

title: Linux DevOps Engineering Specialist (Remote)
description: Associate Principal, Site Reliability Engineering<p><br></p>SALARY $117K - $150K<p><br></p>Hybrid 3 days on site 2 days remote<p><br></p>SELLING POINTS: next generation cloud platform through automation create and enhance runbooks aws splunk container orchestration Kubernetes mesos docker swarm rancher terraform ansible puppet chef Scripting in bash python go ci/cd distributed messaging a plus<p><br></p>Technical Skills<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience managing infrastructure in public cloud environments like AWS (preferred), Azure or GCP.</li><li>Experience providing visibility using monitoring and alerting tools like Splunk, SignalFx, AppDynamics, Datadog, ELK, Prometheus or Grafana.</li><li>Experience with container orchestration systems like Kubernetes, Mesos, Docker Swarm or Rancher.</li><li>Experience with infrastructure as code and configuration management tools like Terraform, Ansible, Puppet or Chef.</li><li>Programming/Scripting experience in languages like Java, Bash, Python or Go.</li><li>Experience with distributed messaging systems like Kafka, RabbitMQ, or ActiveMQ.</li><li>Experience with using Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools like Jenkins, Travis, Harness, Spinnaker, Appveyor, CodeBuild or CodePipeline. </li></ul><p><br></p>Education and/or Experience<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's or Master's Degrees in Computer Science, Information Systems or other related field. Or equivalent work experience.</li><li>Minimum of 5-8 years of experience in Site Reliability Engineering/DevOps</li></ul>

title: ServiceNow Developer
description: Salary: $130k-$145k + bonus<p><br></p>Location: Hybrid role in either location<p><br></p>Chicago, IL/Dallas, TX<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's or Master's Degrees in Computer Science, Information Systems or other related field. Or equivalent work experience.</li><li>Minimum of 5-8 years of experience in Site Reliability Engineering/DevOps</li><li>Experience managing infrastructure in public cloud environments like AWS (preferred), Azure or GCP.</li><li>Experience providing visibility using monitoring and alerting tools like Splunk, SignalFx, AppDynamics, Datadog, ELK, Prometheus or Grafana.</li><li>Experience with container orchestration systems like Kubernetes, Mesos, Docker Swarm or Rancher.</li><li>Experience with infrastructure as code and configuration management tools like Terraform, Ansible, Puppet or Chef.</li><li>Programming/Scripting experience in languages like Java, Bash, Python or Go.</li><li>Experience with distributed messaging systems like Kafka, RabbitMQ, or ActiveMQ.</li><li>Experience with using Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools like Jenkins, Travis, Harness, Spinnaker, Appveyor, CodeBuild or CodePipeline.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborate with development, operations and infrastructure teams to ensure availability of services, and to work through implementation issues.</li><li>Develop automation for incident response and to prevent problem recurrence</li><li>Create and enhance runbooks to respond to service outages or degradations</li><li>Assess the production readiness of services</li><li>Define and track operational metrics for production performance, reliability, scalability and availability</li><li>Architect, develop and maintain shared services and tools to improve reliability and reduce toil across the organization</li><li>Contribute to the team's continuous improvement through research, retrospectives, discussion groups and code reviews</li><li>Provide leadership within the team by guiding and mentoring junior members, and preparing stories for the sprint backlog</li></ul>

title: Software Engineer - Python
description: The Multiphysics Computation Section at Argonne National Laboratory is seeking to hire a postdoctoral appointee. The successful candidate’s research will involve synergistic collaborations with a multidisciplinary team involving engine modelers, CFD and AI/ML experts, and computational scientists to enhance the predictive capability and scalability of multi-scale and multi-physics simulation codes.<p><br></p>The candidate will perform multi-physics and multi-scale computational fluid dynamics (CFD) simulations involving multi-phase flows, turbulent combustion, and heat transfer phenomena for heavy-duty, non-road internal combustion engines (ICEs) by further developing commercial/in-house codes and leveraging high-performance computing (HPC).<p><br></p><ul><li>Develop accurate and computationally efficient CFD models to simulate the chain of physics and chemistry involved with fuel injection, fuel-air mixing, turbulent combustion, and emissions for off-road, rail, and marine engines.</li><li>Perform high-fidelity simulations of heavy-duty ICEs that involve both conventional and low-carbon fuels, such as biodiesel, methanol, and hydrogen.</li><li>Improve the accuracy of two-phase flow models for dynamic coupling of the internal nozzle flow with the ensuing spray in simulations of direct injection applications.</li><li>Develop surrogate models and reduced chemical kinetic models for complex fuels, enabling efficient incorporation of detailed chemistry in engine CFD.</li><li>Work as a part of a multidisciplinary team involving experimentalists, CFD experts, and computational scientists to enable cutting-edge CFD modeling &amp; simulations on the next generation supercomputing architectures.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Position Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ph.D. in mechanical/aerospace engineering, applied mathematics, chemical engineering, or a related discipline.</li><li>Experience in modeling and simulation of three-dimensional two-phase and/or multiphase turbulent reacting flow applications using CFD codes (e.g., CONVERGE, Ansys Fluent, OpenFOAM, etc.).</li><li>Knowledge of internal combustion engine combustion theory and modeling, extensive knowledge of liquid and gaseous fuels for engine applications, good understanding of turbulence, spray, chemical kinetics, reacting flow physics, and turbulent combustion modeling.</li><li>Knowledge of multi-dimensional code development (in C++/C/Fortran) for two-phase/multiphase flow and turbulent combustion applications, and parallel scientific computing,</li><li>Experience in geometry manipulation with computer-aided design software.</li><li>Ability to demonstrate collaborative skills, including the ability to work well with other divisions, laboratories, and universities.</li><li>Skilled communication skills at all levels of the organization.</li><li>Experience presenting and publishing results in peer reviewed society technical reports and journal articles.</li><li>A successful candidate must have the ability to model Argonne’s Core Values: Impact, Safety, Respect, Integrity, and Teamwork.</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience in interdisciplinary collaborative research.</li><li>Knowledge of deep machine learning (using TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.) for multi-fidelity modeling, regression tasks, management and analysis of large datasets, and parallel scientific computing.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Family</strong><p><br></p>Postdoctoral Family<p><br></p><strong>Job Profile</strong><p><br></p>Postdoctoral Appointee<p><br></p><strong>Worker Type</strong><p><br></p>Long-Term (Fixed Term)<p><br></p><strong>Time Type</strong><p><br></p>Full time<p><br></p><em>As an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer, and in accordance with our core values of impact, safety, respect, integrity and teamwork, Argonne National Laboratory is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace that fosters collaborative scientific discovery and innovation. In support of this commitment, Argonne encourages minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities to apply for employment. Argonne considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship status, color, disability, gender, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, marital status, national origin, pregnancy, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.</em><p><br></p><em>Argonne employees, and certain guest researchers and contractors, are subject to particular restrictions related to participation in Foreign Government Sponsored or Affiliated Activities, as defined and detailed in United States Department of Energy Order 486.1A. You will be asked to disclose any such participation in the application phase for review by Argonne's Legal Department. </em><p><br></p><em>All Argonne offers of employment are contingent upon a background check that includes an assessment of criminal conviction history conducted on an individualized and case-by-case basis. Please be advised that Argonne positions require upon hire (or may require in the future) for the individual be to obtain a government access authorization that involves additional background check requirements. Failure to obtain or maintain such government access authorization could result in the withdrawal of a job offer or future termination of employment.</em>

description: <strong>Job#: 1350235<br><br></strong><strong>Job Description:<br><br></strong><strong>Axiom Developer<br><br></strong><strong>Remote<br><br></strong><strong>Contract Opportunity<br><br></strong>For more information contact Myia Augustin at [email protected]<br><br><strong>Contractors Role:</strong> Support 2023 strategic projects. Resource will be playing a key role in some of the development &amp; support activities related to these projects.<br><br><strong>Qualifications;<br></strong><ul><li> Minimum of 6 to 8 years of IT Development experience with minimum of 3 years of Axiom SL controller view development experience is a must.</li><li> Must have the ability to create Axiom objects such As Data Sources, Data Models, Shorthand’s, Portfolios, Aggregations along with other data mapping activities.</li><li> Must have prior experience in mapping and configuring free form reports, tabular reports and automation of Axiom workflows.</li><li> Prior experience on configuring APAC taxonomy reports (Singapore, Australia) and EMEA regulatory reporting initiatives is must.</li><li> Prior experience and knowledge on US regulatory reports is a benefit – FFIEC031, FFIEC041, FFIEC009 etc.,</li><li> Work in the role of an Axiom Developer in a fast-paced environment, must be a self-starter, comfortable dealing with clients, VERY strong communication skills.</li><li> Must have the ability to review project related documents such as BRD, FSD and understand the design and solutions architecture with minimal guidance.</li><li> Hands on development of ETL jobs, Shell scripting and delivering the functionality details in technical specifications.</li><li> Development and review of PL SQL &amp; other DB code to support date sourcing into Axiom.</li><li> Ensuring code written meets the predefined company and departments standards.</li><li> Must have prior performance tuning experience both inside the Axiom controller view as well as at the DB level.</li><li> Preparation and execution of detailed unit test cases.</li><li> Creation of Data Sources, Data Models, Shorthand’s, Portfolios, Aggregations, Fee Form and Tabular Report and workflows using AXIOM controller view tool based on Regulatory report requirements.</li><li> Migration of Axiom components from one environment to another.</li><li> Understanding the Functional documents and work with BA/Users to develop the reports.</li><li> Good experience in Regulatory Reporting and Data Warehousing<br><br></li></ul><strong>Must Have:<br><br></strong>Axiom Developer experience (must have previously developed and not maintained)<br><br><strong>Nice to Haves:<br><br></strong>Past FS experience<br><br><strong>Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li> Configure objects and reports in Axiom<br><br></li></ul>EEO Employer<br><br>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. title: servicenow developer
description: Wabtec Corporation is a leading global provider of equipment, systems, digital solutions and value-added services for freight and transit rail. Drawing on nearly four centuries of collective experience across Wabtec, GE Transportation and Faiveley Transport, the company has unmatched digital expertise, technological innovation, and world-class manufacturing and services, enabling the digital-rail-and-transit ecosystems. Wabtec is focused on performance that drives progress, creating transportation solutions that move and improve the world. Wabtec has approximately 27,000 employees in facilities throughout the world. Visit the company’s new website at: http://www.WabtecCorp.com.<p><br></p>It’s not just about your career… or your job title…it’s about who you are and the impact you are going to make on the world. Do you want to go into uncharted waters…do things that haven’t been done to make yours and someone else's life better? Wabtec has been doing that for decades and we will continue to do so! Through our people, leadership development, services, technology and scale, Wabtec delivers better outcomes for global customers by speaking the language of industry.<p><br></p><em>Summary: </em><p><br></p>The Enterprise Security Engineer role will be responsible for creating enterprise-wide security controls and policies to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information assets. The ideal candidate will have a background in information and cyber security, experience in Microsoft environments, baseline security configurations, framework compliance, and configuration management. This experience should include a strong familiarity with enterprise services, patching, and scanning solutions, and other cyber defense tools as well as an understanding of security-based configurations for anti-virus tools, browser controls and email defense solutions.<p><br></p><em>Duties and Responsibilities:<br></em><ul><li>Design of enterprise-wide security controls and policies to protect against cyber threats in a hybrid and multi-cloud environment.</li><li>Provide security leadership, review, consultation and deliver hardened baselines for all IT tools, solutions, projects, software etc. This includes but is not limited to delivering controls and configurations for the following:</li><ul><li>Patching solution and its individual modules</li><li>Cyber Defense Tools</li><li>Email fraud protections</li><li>Browser security</li><li>Data Loss Prevention solutions<br></li></ul><li>Collaborate with other IT teams to ensure that security controls are implemented effectively on all Wabtec IT projects including but not limited to patching solutions, endpoint management, and browser security.</li><li>Provide secure configurations for cyber defense and security tools and software, including EDR and email protection</li><li>Evaluate risk assessments, vulnerability assessments, and threat modeling to identify potential security risks and vulnerabilities</li><li>Review security audits, assessments, and tests to evaluate the effectiveness of security controls</li><li>Provide support and reporting for compliance to security frameworks such as NIST, ISO, and CIS</li><li>Develop and maintain documentation on security policies, standards, and procedures</li><li>Assess configuration management tools to ensure proper configuration of systems and applications</li><li>Other duties as assigned<br></li></ul><p><br></p><em>Minimum Qualifications</em><em>:</em> (To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.)<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field</li><li>At least 5 years of experience in information and cyber security</li><li>Experience with creating secure baseline configurations and configuration management tool configurations</li><li>Experience with patch management and patch management solutions</li><li>Experience in Microsoft environments</li><li>Experience with security frameworks such as NIST, ISO, and CIS and decomposing them to granular security requirements and configurations.<br></li></ul><p><br></p><em>Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:</em><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to work unsupervised</li><li>Strategic and creative thinking to analyze issues that may arise, and create solutions</li><li>Ability to respond positively to feedback, and implement change in process and procedures as needed</li><li>Familiarity with Tanium</li><li>Familiarity with browser and API security management</li><li>Familiarity with Proofpoint</li><li>Experience with Python, Powershell or related utility languages</li><li>Familiarity with database security is a plus</li><li>Ability to work in a fast-paced environment</li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills</li><li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skill<br></li></ul><p><br></p><em>Physical Demands:</em> (The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee <strong><u>to successfully perform the essential functions of this job</u></strong>. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.)<p><br></p><ul><li>Employee is regularly required to talk and hear</li><li>Employee is regularly required to utilize a computer monitor</li><li>Employee is required to sit or stand at a computer desk for many hours at a time</li><li>Requires daily face-to-face or video interaction with other team members</li><li>Occasional local or international travel may be required<br></li></ul><p><br></p><em>Work Environment: </em>(The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.)<p><br></p><ul><li>The employee will normally work in a temperature-controlled office environment<br></li></ul><p><br></p>Wabtec Corporation is committed to taking on the world’s toughest challenges. In order to fulfill that commitment we rely on a culture of leadership, diversity and inclusiveness. We aim to employ the world’s brightest minds to help us create a limitless source of ideas and opportunities. We believe in hiring talented people of varied backgrounds, experiences and styles…people like you! Wabtec Corporation is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, or protected Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

title: Postdoctoral Appointee – Heavy-Duty Non-Road Engine Modeling
description: <strong>Address: </strong>USA-IL-Chicago-300 South Riverside Plaza<p><br></p><strong>Store Code: </strong>Infrastructure-Network (5118708)<p><br></p>Retail Business Services, ranked No. 25 on Fast Company's 2022 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators, is the services company of leading grocery retail group Ahold Delhaize USA, which includes Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop.<p><br></p><strong>Primary Purpose:</strong><p><br></p>A Platform Engineer will provide expertise and leadership in the design, configuration, and management of all corporate, distribution center and retail digital media devices and associated supporting services. They are expected to work in a fast-paced and challenging environment leveraging forward-thinking technical engineering expertise in the media device and services area of the enterprise.<p><br></p><strong>Duties and Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Provide subject matter expertise in the analysis, design and preparation of technology solutions to meet business needs</li><li> Recommends components for solutions that will work well together across business domains, partner with domain architect or act as the domain architect to ensure adherence to the architectural roadmap</li><li> Accountable for projects/applications/infrastructure meeting business needs are delivered in a timely, cost-effective manner considering all budget aspects including total cost of ownership.</li><li> Ensures project artifacts are developed as required, this includes working with support organizations and suppliers to ensure proper documentation is created and stored in the procedure's manual or document repository.</li><li> Facilitates/completes the creation of communication plans, ensuring that appropriate information is exchanged among key stakeholders.</li><li> Develops complete and robust test plans, cases, and scripts, ensures defects are properly resolved and user acceptance is obtained. Ensures the test scripts and defects are entered and tracked in our department tools.</li><li> Acts as communication point keeping the supplier and business partners informed of infrastructure changes, application changes, data changes or upcoming implementations and ensures business specific impacts are addressed.</li><li> Ensures integration and consideration of assigned business areas against critical business processing, freeze periods, schedule changes, weather events and significant refresh activities.</li><li> Thorough understanding of the business strategy, operations, markets, and key stakeholders.</li><li> Review business processes to understand the capability gaps and opportunities</li><li> Recommends Innovations and business processes /systems simplifications</li><li> Builds close relationships with the function heads and their teams. Advise these teams on how technology can be used to match or outpace competitor performance.</li><li> Works as 3rd level support to help resolve issues within area of responsibility</li><li> Maintains a high level of individual contribution, professional growth, and ability to function effectively and independently, challenges others to do the same.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Master's Degree in Computer Science or Technical field.</li><li> Equivalent training/certifications/experience equivalency will be considered.</li><li> 5 or more years of equivalent experience in relevant job or field of technology.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Post graduate degree advanced training and or certifications in relevant field/s of study preferred.</li><li> Experience in retail or grocery preferred.</li></ul><p><br></p>#DICEJobs<p><br></p>Retail Business Services currently provides services to five omnichannel grocery brands, including Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop. Retail Business Services leverages the scale of the local brands to drive synergies and provide industry-leading expertise, insights and analytics to local brands to support their strategies. We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we foster a community of belonging where everyone is valued.<p><br></p>Retail Business Services is an equal opportunity employer. We comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status or any other characteristic protected by law. We provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. As important as what we do is how we do it. Our team embodies our values of Courage, Care, Teamwork, Integrity and Humor in everything that they do. We have a culture of care that values and celebrates the qualities and perspectives that make us all unique.<p><br></p>If you have a disability and require assistance in the application process, please contact our Talent Acquisition Department at .<p><br></p>For more information, visit .<p><br></p>Job Requisition: 317752_external_USA-IL-Chicago_5252023 IT Engineer Platform<p><br></p>

title: Axiom Developer
description: <ul><li>Flex Time - OT pay on top of competitive base salary|401K, profit sharing, and continuous growth opportunities<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>My client is one the tech sector of a conglomeration of companies (other sects include accountancy and equipment leasing) and needs a strong candidate to help in a wide variety of forward-facing projects. The tech team works in 3 different businesses: 1) Enterprise development, 2) contracting out developers to clients depending on needs, and 3) implementations and integration. Most projects they have are in React and .NET with SQL servers. Due to the consultancy work, having a more diverse tech stack is a plus. The compensation for this role given the experience is a little on the lower end, but they make up for it in Flex Hours which pays OT for all time worked over the standard 8 hours/day. 8 hours/day on a $100k salary comes out to $100k/year, but 9 hours/day is 112,500 annually and so on. If you're ambitious to grow your career by working more than 40 hours a week, this job is for you.<br><br><strong>This role requires coming into the office 2 days a week.<br><br></strong><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>The successful Software Engineer will:<br><ul><li>Architect and develop custom enterprise applications using the Microsoft technology stack and the Angular (or React) framework.</li><li>Lead architecture discussions and documentation around application design and development.</li><li>Manage development teams and support of applications.</li><li>Deploy systems to various production and pre-production environments and troubleshoot issues.</li><li>Create technical documentation such as design documents, specifications, software architecture documents, and instructions.</li><li>Regularly communicate with product owners and interpret requirements.</li><li>Work in a team environment using agile development processes and deliver work on time and within budget.</li><li>Follow up with issues in an efficient manner, including working hand-in-hand with Quality Assurance, Project Management, and/or senior developers.</li><li>Regularly communicate project progress, issues, and risks to team and managers.</li><li>Handle code reviews and quality checks.</li><li>Continue to learn and adapt to new languages and technologies.<br><br></li></ul><strong>This role requires coming into the office 2 days a week.<br><br></strong><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong>The successful Software Engineer has:<br><ul><li>Bachelor's degree or higher in a related field.</li><li>Minimum of 5 years' working experience and strong understanding and exposure to Microsoft .NET. and React</li><li>Minimum of 5 years' working experience and strong understanding and exposure to MS SQL Server and SQL coding.</li><li>Experience in WPF would be a plus</li><li>Strong working experience in responsive website design.</li><li>Working experience in agile development and Microsoft DevOps (or other tools such as JIRA).</li><li>Microsoft Certifications in related areas is a plus.</li><li>Master's degree in technology-related areas is a plus.<br><br></li></ul><strong>This role requires coming into the office 2 days a week.<br><br></strong><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>What's On Offer<br><br></strong>What's on offer for a successful Software Engineer?<br><ul><li>Competitive salary ranging from $120K - $150K on the base (not including yearly bonus &amp; flex-time OT pay)</li><li>Flex Time - OT pay after the 40-hour workweek</li><li>Performance Bonus</li><li>Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision &amp; Basic Life Insurance.</li><li>401K and Profit Sharing (starting at 3%)</li><li>Continuing Education</li><li>Fitness Program</li><li>Emerging Tech</li><li>Short-term/Long-term disability coverage.</li><li>Flexible Time Off Program.<br><br></li></ul><strong>This role requires coming into the office 2 days a week.<br><br></strong><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>Contact: Emily Bodett<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-052023-6065119</strong>

description: <strong>Address: </strong>USA-IL-Chicago-300 South Riverside Plaza<p><br></p><strong>Store Code: </strong>Infrastructure-Network (5118697)<p><br></p>Retail Business Services, ranked No. 25 on Fast Company's 2022 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators, is the services company of leading grocery retail group Ahold Delhaize USA, which includes Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop.<p><br></p><strong>Primary Purpose:</strong><p><br></p>A Platform Engineer will provide expertise and leadership in the design, configuration, and management of all corporate, distribution center and retail digital media devices and associated supporting services. They are expected to work in a fast-paced and challenging environment leveraging forward-thinking technical engineering expertise in the media device and services area of the enterprise.<p><br></p><strong>Duties and Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Provide subject matter expertise in the analysis, design and preparation of technology solutions to meet business needs</li><li> Recommends components for solutions that will work well together across business domains, partner with domain architect or act as the domain architect to ensure adherence to the architectural roadmap</li><li> Accountable for projects/applications/infrastructure meeting business needs are delivered in a timely, cost-effective manner considering all budget aspects including total cost of ownership.</li><li> Ensures project artifacts are developed as required, this includes working with support organizations and suppliers to ensure proper documentation is created and stored in the procedure's manual or document repository.</li><li> Facilitates/completes the creation of communication plans, ensuring that appropriate information is exchanged among key stakeholders.</li><li> Develops complete and robust test plans, cases, and scripts, ensures defects are properly resolved and user acceptance is obtained. Ensures the test scripts and defects are entered and tracked in our department tools.</li><li> Acts as communication point keeping the supplier and business partners informed of infrastructure changes, application changes, data changes or upcoming implementations and ensures business specific impacts are addressed.</li><li> Ensures integration and consideration of assigned business areas against critical business processing, freeze periods, schedule changes, weather events and significant refresh activities.</li><li> Thorough understanding of the business strategy, operations, markets, and key stakeholders.</li><li> Review's business processes to understand capability gaps and opportunities</li><li> Recommends Innovations and business processes /systems simplifications</li><li> Builds close relationships with the function heads and their teams. Advise these teams on how technology can be used to match or outpace competitor performance.</li><li> Works as 3rd level support to help resolve issues within area of responsibility</li><li> Maintains a high level of individual contribution, professional growth, and ability to function effectively and independently, challenges others to do the same</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Technical field and master's degree in Technology and/or Business-related field</li><li> equivalent trainings/certifications/experience equivalency will be considered</li><li> 5 or more years of equivalent experience in relevant job or field of technology.</li><li> 2 or more years of equivalent experience in an advanced role or technical capacity, leading teams directly or indirectly.</li><li> 2 or more years' experience directly responsible for guiding, training or onboarding team members in relevant technologies, capabilities or skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Post graduate degree advanced training and or certifications in relevant field/s of study preferred.</li><li> 3 or more years experience in Agile teams and Product/Platform based operating model.</li><li> 3 or more years of experience in leading teams or advancing technical capability in teams.</li><li> Experience in retail or grocery preferred.</li></ul><p><br></p>#DICEJobs<p><br></p>Retail Business Services currently provides services to five omnichannel grocery brands, including Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop. Retail Business Services leverages the scale of the local brands to drive synergies and provide industry-leading expertise, insights and analytics to local brands to support their strategies. We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we foster a community of belonging where everyone is valued.<p><br></p>Retail Business Services is an equal opportunity employer. We comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status or any other characteristic protected by law. We provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. As important as what we do is how we do it. Our team embodies our values of Courage, Care, Teamwork, Integrity and Humor in everything that they do. We have a culture of care that values and celebrates the qualities and perspectives that make us all unique.<p><br></p>If you have a disability and require assistance in the application process, please contact our Talent Acquisition Department at .<p><br></p>For more information, visit .<p><br></p>Job Requisition: 317755_external_USA-IL-Chicago_5252023 IT Engineer Platform<p><br></p>

title: Software Engineer - Ubuntu Systems Management
description: <strong>Remote - Chicago IL, California, Florida, Illinois, Indiana, Maryland, Massachusetts, New Jersey, New York, Ohio, South Carolina, Virginia, Wisconsin, Washington D.C.<br><br></strong>The American Medical Association (AMA) is the nation's largest professional Association of physicians and a non-profit organization. We are a unifying voice and powerful ally for America's physicians, the patients they care for, and the promise of a healthier nation. To be part of the AMA is to be part of our Mission to promote the art and science of medicine and the betterment of public health.<br><br>We continuously work to embed equity in our internal practices and are committed to increasing the diversity of our staff across all levels of the organization. We intentionally work to create the right conditions to enable our employees to feel that they can be their authentic selves and fully participate in the life of the enterprise.<br><br>We encourage and support professional development for our employees, and we are dedicated to social responsibility. We invite you to learn more about us and we look forward to getting to know you.<br><br>We have an opportunity for a remote Software Engineer II on our Product Development team.<br><br>As a Software Engineer II, you will Participate in a variety of high visibility technology and products that support the JAMA Network publishing process and the AMA EdHub. Ensure full-stack development meets the needs of internal and external stakeholders, including our clients and content partners. Develop proofs-of-concept (POCs), tools and technical assessments supporting research for potential business- and mission-driven initiatives.<br><br><strong>RESPONSIBILITIES:<br><br></strong><strong>Assess And Define Technical Requirements Meeting Business Needs<br></strong><ul><li> Understand business needs, build relationships with the business, and propose solutions to guide decisions ensuring development meets business requirements. </li><li> Help planning of new solutions, including identifying technologies meeting business needs;</li><li> Bring ideas to implementation discussions, help unblock other developers, define user stories and supporting test cases meeting business and technical needs, establish best practices for maintainability, and balance test coverage, risk, and budget. </li><li> Communicate professionally and empathetically, solicit, and provide feedback, actively offer help, and make sure everyone is aligned. </li><li> Work collaboratively on a cross-functional team of developers, designers, and business analysts. </li><li> Create documentation, architecture diagrams, workflows, ERDs. <br><br></li></ul><strong> Develop applications and supporting infrastructure and integration <br></strong><ul><li> Develop both back-end and front-end code applying best practices such as writing test cases to define development and selecting appropriate design patterns. </li><li> Build APIs to integrate data between multiple systems. </li><li> Develop and implement user-friendly tools and products that permit streamlining and automation of email campaigns. </li><li> Identify risks, proactively learn and share and ensure colleagues and vendors understand user stories and requirements. </li><li> Apply software-development life cycle methodology to track bugs and proactively identify, propose, and implement solutions where appropriate. <br><br></li></ul><strong>May Include Other Responsibilities As Assigned<br><br></strong><strong>REQUIREMENTS:<br></strong><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree, Boot Camp, coursework or experience in computer programming and / or Web development. </li><li> Minimum 3+ years of experience programming full stack solutions for the Web. Demonstrated ability to program, test, and debug in most of the following technologies: TypeScript, JavaScript, ReScript, React, Angular, Node.js, Elixir, SQL, GraphQL. </li><li> Strong background in the following preferred:</li><li> RESTful and SOAP APIs. </li><li> Node.js runtime. </li><li> Design Patterns. </li><li> MS SQL, MYSQL. </li><li> Knowledge of full application architecture stack (server, networking, hosting, data modeling, data storage, business logic integration, API layer, monitoring and reporting)</li><li> Demonstrated experience applying design patterns as appropriate to development needs. </li><li> Solid experience with responsive design. Knowledge of accessibility design and related coding practices. </li><li> Experience with cloud hosting environments such as AWS, Microsoft Azure. </li><li> Solid understanding of the Agile development methodology : experience with project tracking tools such as Pivotal, JIRA. </li><li> Knowledge of MongoDB or MarkLogic is a plus. </li><li> Ability to work longer hours when required by project schedule. <br><br></li></ul><strong> Additional Technical Background: <br></strong><ul><li> Back-end: We primarily create applications using Express/Node.js and Elixir</li><li> Front-end: We build and maintain our frontends in React with TypeScript and ReScript. We also support Angular. </li><li> Database: We primarily use MS SQL and MySQL, and support MongoDB and MarkLogic. </li><li> Testing: We use Mocha, Chai, Sinon, Testing-Library. </li><li> ETL: We use Informatica. Knowledge of StreamSets is a plus. </li><li> Mobile: All our apps are being built in React Native. </li><li> Infrastructure: Nearly all our infrastructure is on AWS and managed by Terraform. Our internal applications are deployed via Docker to OpenShift. <br><br></li></ul>The pay range for this position in Chicago IL, California, Florida, Illinois, Indiana, Maryland, Massachusetts, New Jersey, New York, Ohio, South Carolina, Virginia, Wisconsin, or Washington D.C. is 80k-$109k. This is the lowest to highest salary we in good faith believe we would pay for this role at the time of this posting. An employee’s pay within the salary range will be based on numerous factors including, but not limited to, relevant education, qualifications, experience, skills, geographical location and business or organizational needs.<br><br>We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to diversity in our workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. As an EOE/AA employer, the American Medical Association will not discriminate in its employment practices due to an applicant’s race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity and veteran or disability status.<br><br><strong> THE AMA IS COMMITTED TO IMPROVING THE HEALTH OF THE NATION</strong>

title: HIL Engineer
description: <ul><li>10 years plus experience in software testing and minimum of 4 years as Test Lead (leading testing teams Manual &amp; Automation)</li><li>Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and ability to work within a team and in collaboration with different teams</li><li>Experience working virtually in a globally dispersed team</li><li>Good understanding on Testing, Automation Testing, Performance testing concepts, Agile methodology and Knowledge on cloud Infrastructure and database concepts</li><li>Should be able to implement automation strategy and guide the team.</li><li>Experience with different test automation approaches (including BDD and hybrid) using the tools Selenium with Java / Cucumber / GIT - Knowledge at scripting/coding level</li><li>Lead the delivery of testing activities, plans and processes for complex products or services ensuring product quality. Also, facilitates resource planning and resolution of issues that may impede the test effort and drives continuous improvement.</li><li>Responsible for the planning, design, development, and support of test cases for functional and non-functional domains</li><li>Lead the identification of the test scope and test environment set-up, prepares test plans, identifies relevant metrics, and keeps track of required effort for large initiatives</li></ul><p><br></p><em>Diverse Lynx LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive due consideration for employment without any discrimination. All applicants will be evaluated solely on the basis of their ability, competence and their proven capability to perform the functions outlined in the corresponding role. We promote and support a diverse workforce across all levels in the company.</em>

title: DevOps Engineer (Kubernetes)
description: Take your career to the next level as an embedded software engineer, using your expertise in embedded C and MATLAB/Simulink to develop advanced features for the off-highway autonomous vehicle industry and push the technology of flagship vehicles such as tractors, harvesters, combines, and excavators to the next level.<br><ul><li>Your Responsibilities:*</li><li>Design, develop, and test software for enterprise programming and infrastructure solutions</li><li>Operate in a scrum team environment on varying project scope and direction from a project lead</li><li>Support the team with concept, development and testing of solutions</li><li>Software:*</li><li>Embedded C/C++</li><li>MATLAB/Simulink</li><li>Qualifications:*</li><li>Demonstrated capability in software product development using C++, C, Python and scripting languages</li><li>Training or experience with Object-Oriented Analysis/Design (OOA/D) and multi-threaded systems</li><li>Experience that demonstrates you are a self-starter, and able to work well without close direction</li><li>Demonstrated capability performing in an engineering team environment and interfacing with engineers and personnel of other disciplines</li><li>Minimum of 2 years of software industry experience<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Front End Javascript Engineer / Typescript / Angular / Hybrid
description: We're looking for a Fullstack Python Engineer to join a quickly-growing FinTech company with a brand new office in The Loop. Their cutting-edge payment platform enables businesses to streamline transactions, enhance customer experiences, and drive revenue growth.<p><br></p>This company is leveraging its innovative Payments-technology in an untapped sector with lots of opportunity, enabling them to grow by 50% in the next 6 months. As a Fullstack Python Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining both front-end and back-end components of our payment platform. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to create robust and scalable software solutions, ensuring high performance, security, and seamless user experiences. Required Skills &amp; Experience<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).</li><li>Proven experience as a Fullstack Python Engineer or similar role, with a focus on web application development.</li><li>Strong proficiency in Python and related frameworks (such as Django, Flask, or FastAPI).</li><li>Solid understanding of front-end technologies, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern JavaScript frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Vue.js).</li><li>Experience with relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) and database design.</li><li>Knowledge of RESTful APIs and experience building and consuming them.</li><li>Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and agile development methodologies.</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently as well as in a collaborative team environment.</li><li>Excellent communication skills and ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.</li><li>Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment.</li></ul> Desired Skills &amp; Experience<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with cloud platforms, especially Microsoft Azure.</li><li>Familiarity with containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).</li><li>Knowledge of payment systems, financial technology, or related industries.</li><li>Contributions to open-source projects or a strong portfolio of personal projects.</li></ul> The Offer<p><br></p><ul><li>Bonus and Equity eligible</li></ul> You will receive the following benefits:<p><br></p><ul><li>Medical Insurance </li><li>Dental Benefits</li><li>Vision Benefits</li><li>Paid Time Off (PTO)</li><li>401(k) {including match- if applicable}</li></ul><p><br></p>Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis now and in the future.<p><br></p>

As a Fullstack Python Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining both front-end and back-end components of our payment platform. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to create robust and scalable software solutions, ensuring high performance, security, and seamless user experiences. Required Skills &amp; Experience<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).</li><li>Proven experience as a Fullstack Python Engineer or similar role, with a focus on web application development.</li><li>Strong proficiency in Python and related frameworks (such as Django, Flask, or FastAPI).</li><li>Solid understanding of front-end technologies, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern JavaScript frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Vue.js).</li><li>Experience with relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) and database design.</li><li>Knowledge of RESTful APIs and experience building and consuming them.</li><li>Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and agile development methodologies.</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently as well as in a collaborative team environment.</li><li>Excellent communication skills and ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.</li><li>Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment.</li></ul> Desired Skills &amp; Experience<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with cloud platforms, especially Microsoft Azure.</li><li>Familiarity with containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).</li><li>Knowledge of payment systems, financial technology, or related industries.</li><li>Contributions to open-source projects or a strong portfolio of personal projects.</li></ul> The Offer<p><br></p><ul><li>Bonus and Equity eligible</li></ul> You will receive the following benefits:<p><br></p><ul><li>Medical Insurance </li><li>Dental Benefits</li><li>Vision Benefits</li><li>Paid Time Off (PTO)</li><li>401(k) {including match- if applicable}</li></ul><p><br></p>Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis now and in the future.<p><br></p>

title: Enterprise Security Engineer
description: We are a leading recruitment firm specializing in IT professionals, currently seeking a talented and experienced Senior Java Software Engineer for a fantastic permanent position. Join our dynamic team and take advantage of competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits, paid time off, retirement matching, and more! Apply today to unlock this incredible opportunity!<br><br><strong><u>What We Offer<br><br></u></strong>Direct access to hiring managers<br><br>Streamlined and efficient hiring process<br><br>Recruiter representation and advocacy<br><br>20 years of recruitment experience<br><br>Full-time permanent positions only<br><br><strong><u>Perks And Benefits<br><br></u></strong>Competitive base salary<br><br>Amazing company culture<br><br>Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage<br><br>Health and wellness benefits package<br><br>Retirement plan<br><br>Generous paid time off<br><br><strong><u>Position Summary<br><br></u></strong>We are searching for a highly skilled Senior Java Software Engineer with expertise in designing and implementing enterprise-level open-source applications. Based in our Chicago, NYC, or White Plains office, you will collaborate closely with product owners, security teams, architects, and fellow engineers to deliver technical solutions that align with business objectives. As a motivated individual with a programming background and a strong grasp of business processes, you will have the opportunity to explore new technologies, prototype rapidly, and contribute to the selection and integration of cutting-edge tools.<br><br><strong><u>Key Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Lead the development of web applications, delivering direct value to our code following best practices<br><br>Provide coaching and conduct code reviews for new and ongoing development projects<br><br>Collaborate with product owners and stakeholders to balance possibilities engineering, electrical engineering, systems analysis, or a related field, or equivalent training/experience<br><br>3-4 years of software engineering experience<br><br><strong><u>In-depth Knowledge Of The Following Technologies<br><br></u></strong>TypeScript and JavaScript for NodeJS Express web applications<br><br>Angular<br><br>GraphQL (Apollo)<br><br>Modern System Architecture Patterns<br><br>Strong data management principles, including SQL and NoSQL databases<br><br>Agile development, continuous integration, and automated testing<br><br>Proficiency in writing unit, integration, and end-to-end automated tests<br><br>Experience with DevOps, CI/CD pipelines, and associated tools<br><br>Familiarity with SPA libraries/frameworks such as Angular, React, or Vue<br><br>Exposure to designing extract, transform, and load (ETL) tools<br><br>Understanding of mobile application development<br><br>Ability to design systems and data flows between databases and applications<br><br><strong><u>Skills And Attributes<br><br></u></strong>Excellent communication skills, capable of effectively sharing technical knowledge through various mediums<br><br>Structured stakeholders<br><br>Passion for personal and professional growth, actively seeking educational opportunities and staying up-to-date with the latest development tools and techniques<br><br>Join our team and embark on a rewarding career where you can make a significant impact while enjoying a friendly and innovative work environment. Apply now and take the next step towards success!<br><br>Employment Type: Full-Time<br><br>Salary: $ 115,000.00 125,000.00 Per Year

title: Mid-Level Software Engineer - C#/.NET
description: <strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong><strong>JOB SUMMARY <br><br></strong>The Technology &amp; Breakthrough Innovation (TBI) team located in Chicago, IL, Alameda, CA, and Franklin, WI creates some of the world's most cutting-edge products. TBI is looking for an experienced Software Project Engineer to join the team and create data driven software that advances technology and proves out new project concepts. This position emphasis applying Machine Learning (ML) technologies in different S&amp;C products with the focus on edge devices.<br><br><strong>The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to, the following: <br></strong><ul><li>In collaboration with hardware engineers, collecting and mining data on a target, using AI/machine learning tools such as Tensorflow/Python to develop models </li><li>Developing data driven applications to increase the robustness of the electric grid through edge data analytics with embedded Linux. </li><li>Developing new software, debugging and supporting embedded Linux platforms using C/C++, shell script. </li><li>Developing or contributing to the development of project schedules, time estimates, detailed software specifications and test plans. </li><li>Responsible for all aspects of the software design cycle including, architecture design, specifications, analysis, implementation, reviewing code, testing and related documentation. </li><li>Working with product owners to assure product designs meet the requirements of the market. </li><li>Working with application engineers to identify the optimal balance of hardware and software solutions to customer problems. </li><li>Working with software, hardware and test engineers to deliver reliable, mission critical embedded software. <br></li></ul><strong>To select this job as one of interest to you, at a minimum, you must have the following: <br></strong><ul><li>BS degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or Data Science. MS degree in Artificial Intelligence is a plus. </li><li>Knowledge or working experiences with machine learning, deep learning, clustering, dimensionality reduction, data parsing/filtering/visualization using Python </li><li>Experience in developing, testing and debugging software in embedded Linux environment </li><li>Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies, multi-task and set priorities </li><li>Familiarity with Linux (Ubuntu), various Integrated Development Environments (IDE), and container technologies (Docker) </li><li>Familiarity with TCP/IP socket and multi-threaded programming, Web Development (HTML/CSS, JS/TS), Clustering technologies (Kubernetes), or OpenAI is a plus </li><li>Strong analytical skills </li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills. </li><li>Ability to read and interpret technical specifications.  </li><li>Ability to travel less than 10% of the time with some periods lasting more than a week. </li><li>Experience in one or more of the following areas is preferred: Electric grid automation and/or control of power electronics, control for utility applications, predictive analytics with data modeling and evaluation.  <br></li></ul>Major Physical Demands<br><br>Environment: Work performed in a regular office environment but may include time in electric utility sites.<br><br>Number of Openings: 1<br><br>Pay Group: Annual<br><br>Employment Classification: Full Time<br><br>Shift: 1<br><br>Core Working Hours: 8:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m.<br><br>Thank you for your interest in S&amp;C Electric Company. S&amp;C has a proud and longstanding tradition of providing equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or marital status. Further, S&amp;C is committed to taking affirmative action to ensure that qualified females, minorities, veterans, and persons with disabilities can pursue equal employment opportunities. For information regarding equal employment opportunity, please see  http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf .<br><br><strong><u>About Us<br><br></u></strong>In 1909, S&amp;C Electric Company transformed the delivery of safe, reliable electricity with the invention of the Liquid Power Fuse. Today, as the world faces extreme weather events and the demand for electricity grows, S&amp;C continues to innovate and advance the electrical grid, ensuring reliable and resilient power for homes, communities, and critical infrastructure around the world.<br><br>With a diverse, global workforce and core values around integrity, safety, and quality, S&amp;C is a trusted industry leader and top workplace that offers meaningful careers to more than 3,500 team members. As a people-first organization, S&amp;C is committed to fostering an inclusive and collaborative workplace where team members advance their careers through robust talent-development programs and involved leadership.<br><br>S&amp;C’s deeply rooted belief diversity fosters greater creativity, innovation, and success guides the company to advance and sustain a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace culture.<br><br><strong>Organization<br><br></strong>On the <strong>(Admin, HR, General Management, Strategy, IT, F&amp;A, HSE, S&amp;L)</strong> team, we are responsible for several core business functions and collaborate with departments across S&amp;C to collectively achieve S&amp;C's mission. We are key players in facilitating how S&amp;C provides long-term value to our employee owners. Always focused on the big picture of revolutionizing the energy sector, we take pride in the impact we have on S&amp;C by empowering our team members to succeed.<br><br>
industry: Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, Renewable Energy Semiconductor Manufacturing, and Utilities

description: <ul><li>Low Level Device Driver - Software Engineer****** ****Must have experience with LabView and/or TestStand used in a product based manufacturing setting******</li><li>Description:* What they do: (technology and product) - This team supports Targeting/ RF/ IRCM (all business units)<br><br></li></ul>Why it’s open:<br><ul><li>Starting to migrate to a Linux OS – do not currently have someone with driver level development<br><br></li></ul>Team Makeup:<br><br>o<br><br>5 engineers – supporting various teams/ programs across the country Day to day:<br><ul><li>Working in an Agile environment with two week sprints, participating in daily standup meetings</li><li>Primarily doing driver level development on Linux/ VxWorks using C/C++ -Starting with new hardware and doing the BSP</li><li>Creating a Linux distribution using Yocto</li><li>Work will be mostly unclassified (not requiring a clearance)</li><li>May require it when they get to integration stage</li><li>Skills:* Kernel, Linux, Rtos, device driver, VxWorks, C++, yocto, Xilinx, FPGA</li><li>Top Skills Details:* Kernel, Linux, Rtos, device driver, Vxworks, C++<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. title: Fullstack Python Engineer
description: <ul><li>READY TO DO YOUR PART AND HELP PROTECT OUR TROOPS?* I have the position for you! My client is currently hiring for an Embedded Software Engineer to develop products to help protect our troops. In this position you will be working with Embedded C/C++ within VxWorks operating systems for software development. This position requires you to be doing both Embedded C development along with C++ Object Oriented Programming with some being OOD development, design patterns, and deeper OO concepts. This also includes Embedded Software Development and doing application level while working with many different communication protocols and working with RF Electronic Warfare Systems as part of a large team and program.</li><li>Skills:*</li><li>VxWorks</li><li>Clearance</li><li>C/C++</li><li>Embedded C</li><li>Linux</li><li>RTOS</li><li>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications:*</li><li>Must have an active secret clearance as they are putting them on programs asap for cleared work</li><li>Must have experience in real-time system</li><li>Employee Perks:*</li><li>Paid Weekly</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plans</li><li>Abenity Discount Program</li><li>Udemy Courses</li><li>Work Life Balance</li><li>PTO</li><li>Experience Level:* 3+ years of experience working with C/C++<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. title: Software Engineer / Javascript / Typescript / Angular - Remote | Hybrid
description: Help us shape the future of open source IT, devops, and IS, from bare metal to containers. Our goal is to revolutionise open source application and infrastructure operations.<br><br>We are on a mission to reshape the world of software operations, using Python and Golang for next-generation infrastructure-as-code and blazing a trail to model-driven operations. We want to enable companies to run very efficient bare metal operations for high performance computing, private cloud, data lakes and analytics. To achieve this we need to invent some new technology, and we need to build some new products. In support of that goal we hire software engineers who are passionate about quality, reliability and devops.<br><br>This team is part of our fully managed infrastructure operations organisation. Canonical runs many private OpenStack clouds and Kubernetes clusters for customers around the world, which enables us to improve our infra-as-code products based on our own real experience, mirroring that of our users and customers. We work in Python and Golang, creating open source operations capabilities that simplify these operations for anybody, worldwide, who is building on Ubuntu.<br><br>Our team collaborates with product, engineering, and operations teams. Most of the work is pure open source Python software development, with some planned work in Golang. The expectation is to focus on quality, design, documentation, tests and performance. The team develops and enhances our opscode and other open source packages, to ensure our platform is the easiest, most robust, and best performing way to drive your data centre.<br><br>This role is ideal for software engineers who want to work in Python/Golang, have a passion for distributed systems, and an interest in the entire Linux stack - from kernel to networking to virtualization and containers. Our Engineers are technically astute open source enthusiasts who are excited about cloud computing and are ready to join a global team charged with delivering world class services to our customers.<br><br>What you'll do<br><ul><li>Work in Python and Golang to design and deliver open source software operations code</li><li>Work with the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications</li><li>Learn to think rigorously about application and infrastructure reliability</li><li>Shape high quality open source monitoring and alerting infrastructure</li><li>Simplify open source operations for our customers and open source community</li><li>Demonstrate sound engineering design and testing principles in your code</li><li>Follow agile software development practices</li><li>Coach and develop your colleagues where you have insights</li><li>Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values</li><li>Global travel up to 10% of time for internal and external events<br><br></li></ul>Who you are<br><ul><li>University degree in Computer Science or related software engineering field</li><li>Advanced level Python programming skills</li><li>Good to have - Golang programming skills</li><li>You are knowledgeable and passionate about software development </li><li>You are organised and want your team to deliver timely, high quality software</li><li>You have a demonstrated drive for continual learning</li><li>You understand the importance of reliable operations in a devops world</li><li>You have sound knowledge of cloud computing concepts &amp; technologies</li><li>You have practical knowledge of Linux and networking<br><br></li></ul>What you will learn<br><ul><li>Devops and site reliability engineering</li><li>OpenStack and Kubernetes in operation</li><li>Wide range of open source applications and skills</li><li>Real-life and hands-on exposure to a wide range of emerging technologies and tools <br><br></li></ul>We offer:<br><ul><li>Learning and development</li><li>Competitive salary</li><li>Recognition rewards</li><li>Annual leave</li><li>Priority Pass for travel<br><br></li></ul><strong>About Canonical<br><br></strong>Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.<br><br>Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.<br><br><strong>Canonical is an equal opportunity employer<br><br></strong>We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.<br><br>#Stack

description: Immediate need for a talented <strong>Senior React Developer</strong>.This is a <strong>09+ Months </strong>contract opportunity with long-term potential and is located in <strong>Chicago, IL(Hybrid). </strong>Please review the job description below and contact me ASAP if you are interested.<p><br></p><strong>Job ID: 23-22888</strong><p><br></p><strong>Pay Range: $70 - $75/hour. Employee benefits include, but are not limited to, health insurance (medical, dental, vision), 401(k) plan, and paid sick leave (depending on work location).</strong><p><br></p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You will be responsible for writing efficient, testable, and reusable code using React and Redux.</li><li>We are looking for a developer who is passionate about writing the best quality code and has knowledge/experience across multiple technologies.</li><li>A successful developer in this role will be one who can accurately comprehend business requirements and code creative solutions to satisfy those requirements to deliver on the best experience for our customers.</li><li>This role will be working within an agile team environment building and updating design system components for Client and leading the way in enhancing the performance and quality of the codebase.</li><li>Lead the design, development, and planning for solutions that maintain Clients technology standards</li><li>Solve complex performance problems and architectural challenges</li><li>Perform code reviews and mentor your peers</li><li>Help to troubleshoot, test, and maintain the product</li><li>Work in an Agile environment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Key Requirements and Technology Experience: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years of experience in software </strong>organization and we are currently interviewing to fill this and other similar contract positions.
